rows.title: Crimson Saga

objects.title: Select All
objects.text: Select all

rows.title: KRAKAKAKOOM!!!
rows.titleText:
On a bright afternoon, the sky splits open as the earth is struck seven times. 
Heralding the birth of a child of crimson! Each strike will be a trial, a labour. 
Either you stand and be worthy of your blood or fail like the many before you. 
You are of the crimson, the crimson is of you. 
It burns through your body igniting your blood, demanding glory and sin. You feel within you the power to grasp and do the impossible, to break the unbreakable.
Let your legend burn brighter than the two suns that grace Ascarnia. 
Your saga’s will be written in crimson. 

Now come child, before all that tell me of your origins.

rows.title: Origin
rows.titleText: Now, child of crimson...What ilk sired you?

objects.title: Human
objects.text:
Of those who came before, of those who built and were broken in return. Humanity, though not a majority, has spread far across the land of Atresus. Humans come in many shapes and sizes, with skin tones ranging from pale as sunlight to dark as rich mahogany. Despite their diversity, humans share a common trait: the indomitable spirit that drives them to explore, build, and endure.

Their presence is felt in every corner of Atresus, from the bustling cities to the quiet villages. Human ingenuity and resilience have shaped the land, leaving a mark on its history and culture. They adapt to their surroundings, forging communities and creating societies that reflect their values and beliefs.

Gain free will, the ultimate gift of humanity. Free will empowers humans to make choices, to carve their own paths, and to shape their destinies. It is the force that drives them to achieve greatness, to overcome obstacles, and to continuously strive for a better future. With free will, humans are not bound by fate or destiny; they are the architects of their own lives.

objects.title: Ork
objects.text:
A race whose blood is steeped in war, whose ears know the siren song of battle. The orcs are the horde, and the horde are the orcs. No other race throughout Atresus understands battle as deeply as the orcs. They fight all that can be fought, kill all that can be killed, and even sometimes those that cannot. Seen as both noble and barbaric, they embody the duality of war—honor and savagery intertwined.

Their people are the only thing that stands between the greater world and the deadlands. The orcs serve as the unyielding bulwark against the encroaching darkness, their ferocity and strength holding back the tide of chaos. Their warriors are unmatched in prowess, their tactics honed through generations of relentless conflict.

Orc society is built on the principles of strength, courage, and loyalty. Each member of the horde knows their place and purpose, contributing to the collective might of their people. Their bonds are forged in the crucible of battle, and their loyalty to one another is unbreakable.

objects.title: minotaur
objects.text:
The emerald fields are your home, the peaceful lands of the north, where the earth yields its bounty in abundance. Here, food is never scarce, and neighbor does not raise hand against neighbor. The land provides generously, and in return, you nurture it with care. Harmony with nature is a way of life in this serene haven.

The rolling hills and lush meadows stretch as far as the eye can see, dotted with vibrant wildflowers and ancient trees. Rivers and streams flow gently through the landscape, their crystal-clear waters sustaining both the land and its inhabitants. The air is crisp and clean, carrying the scent of blooming flora and the promise of a bountiful harvest.

objects.title: Elfen
objects.text:
The dread forest is your home, where dire beasts and horrors walk through the canopy of leaves. Trees that seem to touch the sky reach out, their branches like roads. None know the horrors of nature like the elfen do. They maintain their cultures and societies through large communes, where each individual plays a role in the cycle of things. If you fail to do your part, you are given to the wilds, let them decide your fate. Magik is unknown to you and will never be known to you, and you care little for it. All you really need is the green; the rest is just noise.

The dread forest is a land of untamed beauty and peril. The towering trees form a dense canopy that casts shadows over the forest floor, creating an eerie, otherworldly atmosphere. The elfen have adapted to this challenging environment, their lives deeply intertwined with the rhythm of the forest. They understand the balance of life and death, growth and decay, and they revere the natural world with a profound respect.
The wilds are both a sanctuary and a trial for those who fail to fulfill their duties. The forest judges them, its creatures and elements testing their resolve and worthiness. This trial by nature is a cornerstone of elfen culture, reinforcing the importance of duty and harmony within the community.

objects.title: Goblin
objects.text:
Some call these a lesser race for their small stature and weak bodies. Let not the words of fools poison thine mind. For what they lack in size, they make up for in malicious cunning. None can compete with the Goblen when it comes to alchemy; the deadliest of poisons and philtres come from their dark tribes. These vicious creatures have prayed to the Crimson their whole lives, offering blood, sweat, and sin. None are so favored by the Crimson as the Goblen, who are gifted with keen intellect for the wicked. Your time may be brief on this world, but you are one of the few who know how to make the most of it.

The Goblen's small stature belies their true capabilities. Their minds are sharp, always plotting and devising new concoctions. Their alchemical prowess is unparalleled, their knowledge of toxins and elixirs unmatched. They have turned their diminutive size into an advantage, using their agility and stealth to outmaneuver and outwit their enemies.
Though their time in this world may be fleeting, the Goblen live each moment to its fullest. They seize every opportunity, leveraging their skills and knowledge to leave a lasting mark on Atresus.

rows.title: Lands (WIP)
rows.titleText: Astresus is a land of mystery and adventure. Of horrors unlike any human eyes have seen and wonders that would make the gods weep.

objects.title: The emerald fields
objects.text:
Growing up here, you learned to till the land, nurturing the earth to yield its bounty. However, as the war started, your peaceful life was disrupted, and you were trained to fight. The conflict has shaped you, transforming you from a farmer into a warrior. The Minotauri, though known for their harmony with nature, have proven to be formidable defenders of their homeland. They have risen to the challenge, displaying bravery and strength in the face of aggression.

The emerald fields, once a symbol of tranquility and abundance, now bear the scars of conflict. The land remembers the bloodshed, each battle leaving an indelible mark on the soil. The Minotauri's resilience and determination to protect their home have become legendary. Their struggle against the invading barbarians is a testament to their spirit and tenacity.

As you fight to defend the emerald fields, you carry with you the hope that one day, the land will be restored to its former glory, a place where peace and prosperity can flourish once more. The lessons you learned in your youth, both in farming and in combat, serve you well in this ongoing struggle. Your dual skills make you a unique asset to your people, embodying the strength and endurance needed to reclaim and protect your homeland

objects.title: The Rikan Tarvin Savanah
objects.text:
In the heart of this land, colossal beasts roam—creatures of immense strength and majesty. The Okono have mastered the art of taming and training these animals, forging a bond that allows them to harness their power for various purposes. These creatures are not just tools but revered companions and symbols of the empire's might.

You have lived in this empire of animals and stone; this is your home, a very militaristic place where discipline and strength are paramount. The Okono Empire has risen to prominence through the strategic use of these beasts, constructing grand cities and fortifications that stand as testaments to their ingenuity. Their society is one of harmony with nature, where the wild and the civilized coexist in a delicate balance. The Okono are skilled hunters, warriors, and craftsmen, their culture deeply intertwined with the land and its creatures.

From the smallest insects to the largest predators, every living thing in the savannah has a place in the ecosystem. The Okono have learned to respect and protect this balance, ensuring that their empire continues to flourish. Their knowledge of the land and its inhabitants is unparalleled, granting them an edge over any who would seek to challenge their dominion.

As you navigate the savannah, you witness the grandeur of the Okono Empire and the majestic beasts that call this land home. The Okono's resilience and adaptability are evident in every aspect of their society, from their intricate architecture to their formidable warriors. The savannah is a land of wonder and danger, where the line between survival and greatness is drawn by the strength and wisdom of its inhabitants.

objects.title: The dreadlands
objects.text: The wastes the dreadlands, the final bastion and home of the Orcs.

objects.title: The Mazashi Tundra
objects.text:
The Mazashi Tundra is a land of contrasts, where ice and flame coexist in a rugged and unforgiving environment. Known for its many hot springs and tar pits, this region is rich in ores, attracting those who seek to harness its natural wealth. The people of the Mazashi Tundra are mainly nomadic, with towns and cities often moving to adapt to the harsh conditions and follow the resources they rely on.

Despite the ever-changing landscape and transient nature of its inhabitants, there is one place that has remained constant throughout the ages: the forges. Renowned for producing the finest armors, these forges stand as a testament to the skill and dedication of the artisans who work there. Their craftsmanship is unparalleled, and the armors they create are sought after by warriors from all corners of the world. Many have paid a king's ransom to possess an item forged here, knowing that only the finest armors leave this place.

Built above a deep volcanic line with ever-burning flames, the forges of the Mazashi Tundra draw their power from the earth's core. This source of constant heat and energy allows the artisans to work with the most challenging materials, imbuing their creations with strength and resilience. The eternal flames symbolize the unyielding spirit of the people who call this harsh land home, and their ability to create beauty and strength even in the most challenging conditions.

The culture of the Mazashi Tundra revolves around the art of armor forging. Each person either forges an armor for themselves, imbuing it with a mystical property unique to their spirit, or they collect the materials and have the armor forged for them by a master artisan.

objects.title: The Mazashi Tundra
objects.text:
The northern Tundra is a land of twisted magik, poisoned by ancient and malevolent energies that seep into the very soil and air. This pervasive magik has caused bizarre and grotesque mutations in both plant life and animals, creating a landscape that is both fascinating and horrifying.

The plant life in the northern Tundra has adapted to the tainted environment in strange ways. Trees with gnarled, twisted trunks ooze a glowing, viscous sap that can either heal or harm, depending on how it is used. Carnivorous plants with oversized, bioluminescent petals lure unsuspecting prey into their grasp, snapping shut with unnatural speed. The flora here is as dangerous as it is beautiful, a testament to the corrupting influence of the magik that permeates the land.

Animals in the northern Tundra have also undergone dramatic changes. Predators with multiple sets of eyes and elongated limbs stalk the shadows, their glowing bodies illuminating the darkness. Herbivores have developed thick, spiked hides to protect themselves from both the environment and the predators that hunt them. Some creatures have even gained the ability to harness the magik themselves, using it to enhance their abilities and survive in this harsh, otherworldly landscape.
The ever-present darkness that falls over the northern Tundra when the sun sets only adds to the eerie atmosphere. In this land where the moon never shines, the bioluminescent glow of the mutated creatures and plants provides the only light, casting an eerie, otherworldly glow over the landscape.

objects.title: The Mazashi Tundra
objects.text:
The Heart Forge stands as a beacon of craftsmanship and innovation. Its forges, built above a deep volcanic line with ever-burning flames, draw power from the earth's core, providing the artisans with a constant source of heat and energy.
Growing up in the Heart Forge, you learned the value of hard work and dedication. Whether you started as a lowly fire blower, slowly rising to become a full-fledged artisan, or were born into a family of renowned metal workers, the forge became an integral part of your life. The air is always thick with the smell of molten metal, the rhythmic clang of hammers, and the intense heat that permeates every corner of the forge.
Here, the artisans strive to recreate the wonders of old, drawing inspiration from ancient techniques and combining them with innovative methods.

rows.title: Lesser Abilities
rows.titleText: Take as many as the fruits of your labour can afford you.

objects.title: Strength
objects.text: There are those born with strength, and then there are those born with something beyond strength. To split boulders with a single swing of your fist, to wrestle beasts with your bare hands, to mold iron as though it were clay—yours isn't just strength, but incredible durability as well. No hammer can be stronger or weaker than the metal it was forged from. Still, there are things out there that can break even the mightiest hammer.

objects.title: Celerity
objects.text: You have witnessed the drakes and envied their freedom. You long for their speed, capable of crossing distances that would take a man days in mere hours. Your desire drove you to attain such agility. Although the drakes may be faster, you have come close enough. In battle, your movements are a blur to untrained eyes. Yet, there are both beasts and men whose speed can rival your own.

objects.title: Magiks
objects.text: The raw sorcerers who bend the world and reality around them, imposing their beliefs as truth. They harness the stellar waves, call upon the cosmic squids that traverse the stars, and commune with the astral phoenixes to learn about the world between. However, working with these magiks comes with great risk. Magiks can be unforgiving. A small mistake can lead to a slow and painful demise, causing an eternity of pain and torment to be experienced within a fraction of a second. The crimson will not care, the crimson will not pity.

objects.title: Alchemy
objects.text: Alchemy is the art of transforming the marvellous and the mundane to make the improbable possible. It involves capturing a cat's footsteps and a mountain's roots to create philtres and potions. Alchemists can craft fiendish flame mixes and astral gales, and even produce everyday materials like gunpowder. However, alchemy can be unpredictable, and many have perished before mastering their craft.

objects.title: Smithery
objects.text: The metal whispers to you, asking for your hands to give it form. You have learned to craft all manner of items from metal: swords, shields, armor, and even the mundane nails, hinges, and pots. Your skill allows you to shape metal into anything you desire. With time, training, and practice, your creations may be considered masterworks, each taking less time and achieving higher quality than the last. However, the legendary works of old remain beyond even your considerable gift.

objects.title: Runemaster
objects.text: You bend the world to your will through marks and carvings. You understand the language of the universe, a knowledge that the dragons once mastered before moving on to greater works. In their time, they created both wonders and horrors with a single rune. While you may only grasp a sliver of this power, a sliver is more than enough to shape reality itself.

objects.title: Regeneration
objects.text: You heal faster than you should. Wounds mend in the heat of battle, bones snap back into place, cuts seal within moments. You have never known sickness, and poisons are only 10% effective on you. However, there is a limit to this ability. The more wounds and poisons you take at once, the less effective your healing becomes. Your recovery will slow. You are not invincible—the crimson does not tolerate fools. Remember that. Use what you have to your advantage but do not come to rely on it. Nothing is infallible.

objects.title: Adaptability
objects.text:
Humanity is renowned for its adaptability, a trait that often manifests in halfbloods. When you find yourself on the brink of death, your body does not heed the call of Dovka. Instead, it fights on. What hurt you yesterday has less effect on you today.

However, this growth is always marginal. You will not see the fruits of your labour until you reach old age—until your hair turns grey and your eyes grow clouded. This trait compounds well with the berserker, enhancing your resilience and endurance in battle.

objects.title: Forked tongue
objects.text: Yours is the way of words. To charm and deceive, to cheat and seduce. You possess a skill with words that others do not. You know how to get the right discounts, and you are well-connected with the right people. Your eloquence and cunning enable you to navigate any social or business situation with ease.

objects.title: Will
objects.text: To do what must be done. To go beyond pain and misery, beyond hell and even heaven. Once you have made a choice, you will see it through. Your will is great, greater than any mind control. You do exactly as you say. What the spirit desires, the mind will understand, and the body will achieve. This doesn’t mean you are capable of doing anything. It means that as long as you have the knowledge, resources, skills, and time, there is nothing mundane you cannot learn. This skill greatly enhances others.

objects.title: Mute
objects.text:
Sorceries roll off you like summer rain, runes sizzle and pop before reaching you. Curses and hexes are nothing but hot air from the mouths of fools. Direct attacks through these methods are pointless—they do nothing to you. However, that doesn't stop someone from hurling rocks or trees at you. You are a mute. Magiks and their effects are lost to you. You cannot call for aid from flame, and magical beings avoid you like the plague.

Expect magically inclined allies and companions to find your very presence disturbing. Even alchemical remedies cannot aid you—their healing properties are ravaged by your soul. Magikal blades and armour will be useless, reduced to mere steel and iron. You cannot control the effects of being a mute

objects.title: Berserker
objects.text:
Shield biter, berserker syndrome, mad wolf blooded, the black rage—these are just some of the names used to refer to your affliction. Something simmers within you, hot and foul, desiring nothing but destruction. It craves the blood of both friend and foe, sinner and innocent alike. The urge to bleed and rend is ever-present.

Many berserkers die young, either losing a battle or being put down by the very allies they once fought alongside. The number of berserkers who have reached old age can be counted on one hand. Yet, you have lived longer than most, defying the odds.

objects.title: Survival
objects.text: You have an intimate knowledge of nature and survival. You are tempered and resilient. The cold does not rob your body of its warmth, nor does the heat strip you of your water. Whether you're at the tallest mountain or in the thickest jungle, you can make a home for yourself and thrive. Your body is remarkably efficient, extracting nearly every piece of nutrient and fat ingested. You can endure weeks and even months without water, and you require only four hours of sleep a month.

objects.title: WeaponsMaster
objects.text: In your hands, blades hum and arrows sing. No dagger nor spear will ever be sharper than the one in your grasp. Be it a club or shield, there is no weapon unknown to you. What takes masters years to learn, you master in mere weeks. However, the more exotic the weapon, the longer it will take to master.

objects.title: To cut
objects.text: You walk a path of enlightenment that few dare to tread. With spear, dagger, or sword, you have mastered the art of splitting. Distance matters little to you, for it is the sharpness of your tool and the harmony you have cultivated over a lifetime that truly matter. Whether your enemy stands before you or a few blocks away, you will cut them down. The only things that give you pause are the people and objects between you and your target. Unless, of course, they too are deemed insignificant.

objects.title: Tatakae
objects.text:
Through fear, bribery, inspiration, or a mix of all the above, you possess the ability to transform a coward into a fearless soldier willing to walk through hell and back with you. Given time, you can take the most spineless, lily-livered, yellow-bellied mob and forge them into a capable fighting force, provided you can teach them to fight.

This talent can be used to inspire armies or encourage allies. When you fight side by side with them, the effect is doubled.

rows.title: Greater Abilities
rows.titleText: Through every battle and every challenge, your abilities have grown. Through trials and tribulation, the crimson had dubbed you worthy. Some of your abilities have grown, becoming more than their sum of parts.

objects.title: Denial
objects.text:
To deny is to assert that your will is greater than what is occurring. When a sorceress hurls lightning at you, you deny it ever striking. If your will is greater, there is almost nothing that can affect you. After mastering the abilities of mute through sheer willpower, you can now control its effects. You can deny what you please and accept what you desire. Healing works slightly better, as though the magiks recognize your supremacy over them. You can now deny the direct effects of magik as long as your will is greater than the caster's.

With time, practice, and suffering, you can learn to turn aside the mightiest blows that can shear through mountains. You start at the bottom with the bare bones of this ability. Nothing will be handed to you in crimson. You will either earn it or fail.

objects.title: True rage
objects.text:
Yours is no longer the mindless destruction of hot rage, nor is it tame. You have reached a lesser truth of being. Your rage now burns coolly, scorching away the fog of your emotions. This is the calm rage, the rage that brings clarity, the rage that, when guided, will unleash unparalleled destruction. A cool and directed force—I pity the fool who stands in its way. You are no longer the shield biter but the guide of rage.

In this state, your mind becomes a weapon as sharp as any blade, calculating and precise. Your movements, once driven by blind fury, are now deliberate and controlled, each strike landing with devastating accuracy. The world slows down around you, allowing you to perceive and react to threats with uncanny speed.
It is a force to be wielded with wisdom and purpose, guiding you through the chaos of conflict and beyond.

objects.title: Outer sorcery
objects.text:
Failure is not an option, for your will guides your works. The dangers of the unforeseen world are merely secondary. Nothing sorcerous is beyond your grasp. Learn the dreadful arts from Deadking Ottar the Foul, and unleash the unholy mistress who made the celestials turn from Atreseus. All you need is time. Create spells and effects that can span an entire continent. Within your mind lies the power to split the sky with but a word.

Your journey into the arcane depths is relentless and unparalleled. The secrets of ancient tomes and forbidden knowledge are at your fingertips. Each incantation you master brings you closer to understanding the very fabric of reality. With every spell, you weave a tapestry of power that few can comprehend, let alone challenge.

objects.title: Artifact creator
objects.text:
To create is to believe that what you make will be better than what already exists. The metal answers you, yielding to your touch. The stone sings to you, telling tales of old. The flames of the forge will never burn you, and nothing you forge will ever harm you. With this mastery, you can create wonders: blades that carry the kiss of the infernal, shields that believe themselves as sturdy as mountains, staffs that harness the ethereal, and boots that carry the footfalls of a cat.

Your craftsmanship is legendary, transcending the ordinary to reach the realm of the extraordinary. Each creation is imbued with a piece of your essence, a testament to your skill and vision. The items you forge are not mere tools or weapons; they are masterpieces, each with a story and a soul.

In your hands, raw materials are transformed into artifacts of immense power and beauty. You can forge armors that can withstand the fiercest of blows, and jewels that can channel the energies of the cosmos. Your work attracts the attention of kings and warriors, mages and scholars, all seeking to wield your unparalleled creations.

With time and dedication, your abilities will continue to grow. You will unlock secrets known only to the most ancient of smiths and artisans, pushing the boundaries of what is possible. As you refine your craft, your creations will become even more potent, embodying the perfect harmony of form and function.

objects.title: Pankration
objects.text:
You need no greater sorcery, no mind tricks, no denial, no hiding behind berserking rage and emotions. For what is it to deny what is true? No, yours is something purer, something truer. Yours is the road of attrition, the path of endurance that transcends mere strength. To swing your fists with enough force to hurl gusts of wind, to look up at the skies and lunge with enough power to rip wyverns from the sky, to split mountains with a single strike—these are your capabilities.

The winds have kissed your feet and deemed you worthy of their gift. Distances mean nothing to you now. With your blessings and endurance, no distance is too far, no place unreachable as long as there is a path. You accept all attacks for what they are, enduring both sorcery and blade without flinching, always waiting and ready to strike. Sorcery and armor are wasted on you, for what weapon is greater than your fist, what shield stronger than your body?

Only abilities from the greatest of powers can wound your flesh, only they can turn your fist. The only question is, for how long? Lesser abilities are nothing to you; they bring only pain. But what is pain to the enduring mountain? What is agony to the crimson? Nothing but the words of those beneath you.

Your presence alone commands respect and fear. You stand as a paragon of resilience, a symbol of unwavering determination. Those who face you in battle quickly learn that their conventional tactics are futile. Your strength is not just physical but also a testament to your indomitable spirit.

Your journey has been one of relentless pursuit, overcoming insurmountable odds and pushing the boundaries of what is possible. Every challenge you face only serves to strengthen your resolve. The essence of endurance flows through your veins, empowering you to achieve feats beyond the grasp of ordinary beings.

Embrace your path, for it is a testament to your true nature. You are a force of nature, unyielding and unstoppable. Let the world bear witness to your might, and let your legacy be one of unparalleled endurance and strength.

objects.title: Philosopher’s stone
objects.text:
Your alchemy has reached its pinnacle; you have gained an understanding that many have devoted entire bloodlines to finding and still have failed. You have managed to create Materia Prima, the next element, better known as the philosopher's stone. This perfect element embeds itself within you. With its merging comes the wonders of eternal youth. You are brought back to your prime, and your body gains abilities that rival regeneration, strength, and survival in their potency. Though not as powerful as if you had been born with these traits, this transformation still puts you leagues above others in the world.

The philosopher's stone imbues you with unparalleled vitality. Wounds that would incapacitate others heal rapidly, your strength allows you to perform feats that defy human limits, and your endurance enables you to survive in the harshest of conditions. Your senses sharpen, granting you heightened awareness and reflexes that few not blessed with the crimson can match.

objects.title: The darwin
objects.text:
With each cut and wound upon your person, your body has grown and learned to heal. Wounds close up in the blink of an eye, and limbs regenerate over time. More precise parts, like an eye, may take longer. Disease and sickness are a thing of the past. With each encounter, you gain immunity, whether it be to flame or ice. The time it takes to gain resistance is a fraction of what it once was. Though you possess an untold amount of adaptability, you can only manifest five abilities at a time, and it takes a moment to switch between them. Scars heal without blemish, leaving no trace of the injury behind.

Your body's ability to heal and adapt is unmatched. The scars that once marked your skin are now symbols of your strength and resilience. Each injury has made you stronger, more resilient, and better prepared for the challenges ahead. Your immune system is unparalleled, quickly recognizing and neutralizing threats. Whether it be from pathogens or environmental hazards, you remain unscathed.

Your adaptability goes beyond just physical healing. Your body adapts to extreme conditions, allowing you to thrive in environments that would be fatal to others. You can withstand scorching heat, freezing cold, and everything in between. Your senses sharpen in response to your surroundings, granting you heightened awareness and reflexes.

Furthermore, you have stopped aging and have achieved biological immortality. Time no longer wears on your body, and you remain perpetually in your prime. This grants you an eternal presence, allowing you to gather wisdom and experience beyond the lifespan of ordinary beings.

This unparalleled adaptability makes you a force to be reckoned with. In battle, your enemies find it nearly impossible to exploit a weakness, as you quickly adapt to their attacks. Your ability to switch between different resistances and abilities in the heat of combat gives you a significant advantage.

objects.title: To sever
objects.text:
To cut, to sever, to separate. You have reached the pinnacle of this ability. There is no need for a blade, spear, or dagger. The mere act of waving your hand is enough. Whether it be flesh, stone, or spell, yours is the divine act of parting. Those with greater abilities will require more effort to part than those without.

Your mastery of this skill allows you to cleave through any material with ease. The air itself seems to yield to your command, parting as you move. In battle, your enemies fall before you, their defences rendered useless by your sheer precision and power. You can sever the bonds of magik, dispelling even the most potent spells with a mere gesture.
With this power, you are a force to be reckoned with. Your enemies tremble at the sight of you, knowing that no barrier, no defense, can withstand your might. Yet, this immense power requires control and wisdom. The act of parting is not one to be taken lightly, for it can have far-reaching consequences.
Harnessing this ability to its fullest potential will demand discipline and a deep understanding of its nuances.

objects.title: Warmaster
objects.text:
You need no soft words, harsh whips, nor golden coins. Men and weapons alike see you and feel compelled to strive for better. To achieve even a sliver of what you carry within you. Weapon masters, who have dedicated themselves to a single weapon, weep with joy as they witness your techniques. Soldiers rally and hold the line at the mere mention of your name. The moment you set foot on the battlefield, half the fight is already won.

Your presence is a beacon of inspiration, driving those around you to push beyond their limits. Even the most seasoned warriors find themselves awed by your prowess, seeking to emulate your mastery. Your very aura commands respect and loyalty, transforming ordinary men into extraordinary fighters.

On the battlefield, your leadership is unparalleled. Your strategies and tactics are executed with precision, and your allies follow your commands without hesitation. The enemy falters, knowing that they face not just a skilled combatant, but a legend. Each move you make, each command you give, reinforces the morale of your troops and strikes fear into the hearts of your foes.

Your influence extends beyond the battlefield. In training grounds and war rooms, your name is spoken with reverence. Aspiring warriors look up to you as the epitome of excellence, striving to learn from your example. Your legacy inspires generations, shaping the future of combat and leadership.

rows.title: Regalia(WIP)
rows.titleText: In your travels you would have encountered tools o

objects.title: The spear of Akaton and her grace
objects.text:
The spear of Akaton's design is a testament to the warrior's skill. Its balance and aerodynamic shape make it an extension of the warrior's arm, effortlessly cutting through the air. The wind attribute not only enhances its speed and range but also ensures it never strays far from its master. The spear returns like a loyal companion, ready to be wielded again.

Her Grace, the shield, is equally impressive. Its weight is perfectly distributed, providing maximum protection without hindering mobility. When an enemy's strike is deflected, the shield's hidden mechanism activates, releasing a shockwave that can disrupt even the most coordinated attacks. This defensive capability turns the tide of battle, creating opportunities for counterattacks and strategic maneuvers.

objects.title: Fleet foot
objects.text:
The magic imbued in these soles grants you unparalleled agility and balance. Whether you traverse treacherous terrains, scale vertical walls, or skim across the surface of a lake, your footing remains secure and unwavering. The comfort provided by Kaku's breath ensures that you can move swiftly and tirelessly, free from the aches and fatigue that would burden others.

This adaptability enhances your mobility, enabling you to navigate environments that would otherwise be impossible to traverse.

Kaku's breath, infused within the material, also lends a sense of buoyancy, allowing you to walk on water as if it were solid ground. Your movements become fluid and graceful, each step a testament to the enchantment woven into the soles.

objects.title: Inkings
objects.text:
Whether they are tribal markings granted by the priests of Gravitah or simple geometric shapes, these markings have been infused with mana, acting as an extra layer of protection. They function like a second armor, doubling your current durability. These tattoos are a mix of both, combining the best of both worlds.

The intricate designs of these mixed markings are not merely for show. Each line and curve is imbued with powerful mana, creating a mystical barrier that shields you from harm. This protective enchantment fortifies your body, making you more resilient against physical attacks and magical assaults alike.

The tribal markings, bestowed upon you by the revered priests of Gravitah, carry with them the blessings and strength of your ancestors. They are symbols of your heritage, a testament to your connection with the divine. These sacred markings resonate with the energy of the earth, enhancing your natural defenses and grounding you in times of turmoil.

The shapes, precise and symmetrical, represent the balance and harmony of the cosmos. They channel the raw mana from the surroundings, transforming it into a protective shield that adapts to the nature of incoming threats. This magical armour not only absorbs damage but also disperses it, lessening the impact on your body.

The tattoo can take whatever shape or form you desire.

objects.title: Frinaks touch
objects.text:
When worn, these gloves transform your hands into conduits for the raw, fiery power of a volcanic elemental. You can unleash torrents of scalding ash and sulfur, creating a smokescreen that chokes and blinds your enemies. The sulfur's toxic fumes can incapacitate foes, while the ash clouds obscure vision, providing you with a strategic advantage.

In addition to ash and sulfur, you can also generate blasts of superheated air, capable of searing flesh and igniting flammable materials. This scorching wind can be used to create barriers of intense heat, repel attackers, or devastate your surroundings. The gloves' ability to produce such extreme temperatures makes them a formidable tool in both offense and defense.
However, the spirit inhabiting these gloves is temperamental and demands respect. If you use the gloves for trivial purposes, the spirit's ire may manifest, causing the gloves to become unpredictable or even refusing to cooperate. The spirit craves the thrill of battle and the challenge of worthy opponents, and it expects its power to be used accordingly.

objects.title: The wings of Ikari
objects.text:
The wings of Ikari are a marvel of both strength and agility. With their powerful strokes, you can navigate the skies with unmatched speed and grace.
 These magnificent wings allow you to soar twice as fast as any drake. Their durability makes them formidable shields in battle, capable of withstanding significant damage before they are compromised. Outside of combat, they fold and retract into a fraction of their size, becoming unobtrusive and manageable.

objects.title: Skeleton key
objects.text:
This remarkable key is a powerful artifact that transcends ordinary locks and barriers. Its primary ability to open doors to previously visited locations makes it an invaluable tool for swift and efficient travel.
The key’s secondary function as a skeleton key adds another layer of utility. It can unlock almost any door, gate, or barrier, regardless of the complexity of the lock. This dual-purpose nature ensures that the key remains useful in a wide range of situations, from escaping perilous encounters to accessing hidden treasures.

objects.title: Helm of Hugin and Mugin
objects.text:
When you wear the Helm of Hugin and Munin, your mind opens to the past, offering a perspective that is both detached and insightful. This third-eye view lets you re-examine events with an objective eye, catching nuances and details that were previously overlooked. This ability is invaluable for analyzing battles, solving mysteries, or simply understanding past events more clearly.

The helm’s power extends beyond your own memories. With consent, you can delve into the minds of others, exploring their recollections with the same clarity. This shared experience can foster understanding and cooperation, as you gain insight into their thoughts and experiences.

However, forcing your way into someone else’s mind is a different matter. The intrusion is painful for the person, causing discomfort and potential harm. The memories you extract in this manner are often distorted, their clarity and quality diminished by the forceful extraction.

objects.title: The magisters Robes
objects.text:
The fabric of the Magister's Robes is woven from rare materials that adapt to the wearer's body temperature, ensuring comfort in any weather condition. This adaptability allows you to focus on your tasks without the distraction of environmental discomfort, whether you're in the scorching desert or the icy tundra.

In addition to their climate-regulating properties, the robes significantly boost your magik reserves. The enchantments embedded within the fabric draw ambient mana from the surroundings, channeling it into your body. This continuous influx of mana not only replenishes your energy but also amplifies your spellcasting abilities, enabling you to perform more powerful and complex magik.

objects.title: The half mask
objects.text:
A mask of unknown design, this artifact holds the power to induce transformations within you. By wearing it, you can become any beast you have slain. However, the larger and more formidable the creature, the longer and more excruciating the transformation process.

Transforming into smaller creatures is relatively quick and painless, allowing you to adapt their abilities and traits with ease. You gain the agility of a fox, the keen senses of a wolf, or the stealth of a panther. These transformations are invaluable in situations that require cunning and finesse.

However, becoming larger and more powerful beasts comes at a cost. The transformation process for such creatures is agonizing, your body contorting and reshaping to accommodate their immense size and strength.

objects.title: The sunstone medallion
objects.text:
Crafted from a rare sunstone, the medallion glows with a radiant light that symbolizes the power and wisdom of Solaris. The shamans bestow it upon individuals who have demonstrated exceptional courage, wisdom, and dedication to their community. Wearing the medallion is not just an honor; it is a testament to the bearer’s achievements and virtues.

In addition to its symbolic significance, the Sunstone Medallion imbues the wearer with unique powers. The medallion harnesses the energy of the sun, channeling it into the wearer and granting them enhanced vitality and strength. Under its influence, the wearer becomes more resilient, able to withstand physical and magical attacks with greater ease.

The medallion also enhances the wearer's ability to influence and inspire others. Its aura of authority and respect commands attention, allowing the wearer to lead with confidence and charisma.

How you got the medallion is saga in itself. Maybe one day you will tell it.

objects.title: Thunderers Keen
objects.text:
This spear is a weapon of immense power and sorrow. The storm elemental's essence infuses the weapon, granting it the ability to harness the fury of the storm. With a mere thought, the spear can summon lightning, unleash powerful gusts of wind, and command the raw energy of the tempest. This elemental power makes the spear a formidable tool in battle, capable of overwhelming foes with the relentless force of nature.

However, the spear also bears the weight of the spear saint's lament. The tragic act of slaying her beloved haunts the weapon, imbuing it with a deep sense of loss and sorrow. This emotional resonance affects those who wield it, filling their hearts with a melancholic determination. The spear saint's regret serves as a reminder of the sacrifices made in the name of duty and honor.

The spear's design reflects its dual nature. Its shaft is etched with symbols of the storm, crackling with latent energy, while the blade is inscribed with intricate patterns that tell the story of the spear saint's love and loss. The weapon is both beautiful and haunting, a testament to the power of love and the tragedy of fate.
It requires a wielder who understands the gravity of their actions and the weight of their decisions. As you take up this weapon, you inherit not only its formidable power but also the legacy of its past.

Will your story be one of redemption and healing, transforming its tragic legacy into one of hope and new beginnings? Or will it be a tale of relentless struggle, where every strike is a testament to the sacrifices you've made?

objects.title: The morning star
objects.text:
Dawnbringer is a masterpiece of craftsmanship and magik, its chain imbued with the divine essence of celestial silver. The metal's unique properties allow the whip to extend and retract, adapting to the needs of the wielder in any combat situation. This versatility makes it an invaluable tool for monster hunting, enabling you to strike from a distance or close in for a more precise attack.

The legacy of the Belhaunt family is woven into the very fabric of this whip. Each heir who has wielded it has left an imprint of their will and determination, making the weapon an extension of their spirit. This connection endows the whip with an almost sentient awareness, responding to the wielder's intent and amplifying their prowess in battle.

When used against dark creatures and eldritch abominations, Dawnbringer's true power is revealed. The celestial silver flail ignites with a holy fire, burning away the darkness and purifying the corruption. This ability to cleanse and destroy evil makes the whip a formidable weapon against the most terrifying foes, ensuring that you stand as a bulwark against the encroaching shadows.

objects.title: Kongar's Lament's
objects.text:
The bow, now imbued with the legacy of the Elfen, is a weapon of immense power and deep sorrow. The Elfen's triumph over the quantum dragon was a monumental feat, averting a disaster that could have reshaped the world. This act of heroism and sacrifice is woven into Kongar's Lament, making it a symbol of courage and resilience.

The bow's construction from the bones of the Elfen's deer mount adds a layer of reverence and connection to the spirit world. This minor spirit, loyal and true, gave its life in the struggle against the dragon, and its essence lives on in the bow. The bond between the Elfen and his mount is honored in every arrow the bow creates.

One of Kongar's Lament's most remarkable features is its ability to grow bone arrows, customized to the precise needs of the user. These bone arrows possess unique properties, allowing them to change shape, grow to different lengths, or explode into a shower of spines upon impact. This versatility makes the bow an unparalleled tool for archers, ensuring they are always prepared for whatever challenges they face.

Though the tome is only as detailed as your existing knoweldge on magik,the more you know the more detailed the explanations are, giving you a different perceptive, However if youre not magikly inclined or you already know the spell, you can burn up a page and activate the spell. You only have a set number of pages and can only hold so many spells. They pages replashing usning ambient mana you can speed up the recovery by a half as long as you have mana or mana crystals.
This tome is a repository of arcane knowledge, designed to store any spells you've learned, seen, or been attacked with. It meticulously records the details of each spell, allowing you to study them later at your discretion. The tome's pages are enchanted with a spell-capturing charm, ensuring that no magical incantation escapes its grasp.

However, the tome's detail is only as extensive as your existing knowledge of magik. The more you know, the more detailed the explanations are, offering you a different perspective and deeper understanding. If you're not magikly inclined or you already know the spell, you have the option to burn up a page and activate the spell directly.

You only have a set number of pages, and the tome can hold a limited number of spells. The pages replenish using ambient mana, but you can speed up the recovery by half if you have access to mana or mana crystals. This feature makes the tome a strategic tool, allowing you to decide when to store spells for study or use them in critical moments.

objects.title: The ebon plate
objects.text:
By adjusting the armor's weight, you can enhance your agility and speed by making it lighter or increase your stability and strength by making it heavier. This ability can be particularly useful in combat, allowing you to adapt to different opponents and environments with ease.

The effect extending to whatever you hold further amplifies the armor's versatility. Weapons, tools, or other items you carry will be influenced by the weight alteration, providing you with additional strategic options. Whether you need to swing a lighter weapon with greater speed or wield a heavier one for more powerful strikes, the armor can adapt to your needs.

While the armor's weight-manipulating ability is impressive, it's important to remember that its overall durability is comparable to that of a well-made suit of armor.

When activated, the aura takes on a physical form, mirroring your appearance but on a grander scale. This larger version of yourself is imbued with heightened resilience, providing superior protection against attacks. The enhanced strength allows you to perform feats of power and endurance that would be impossible in your normal state.

rows.title: Quest Regalia(WIP)
rows.titleText: In your travels you would have encountered tools o

rows.title: Mount(WIP)
rows.titleText: Only take this if you did the equivalent life event.

objects.title: Vakah
objects.text:
Vakah's presence is serene yet powerful, his striking blue fur and piercing eyes exuding a sense of mystique. As a spiritual mount, Vakah's bond with you is not just physical but also deeply spiritual. This connection amplifies your abilities, granting you access to the profound psychic energies that Vakah embodies.

The ability to conjure a psychic storm is a testament to the strength of your bond. When you call upon this power, a tempest of psychic energy swirls around you, disorienting and overwhelming your foes. This storm is a manifestation of the deep connection between you and Vakah, a reflection of the unity between rider and mount.

Vakah's telepathic communication adds another layer to your partnership. His calm and wise nature provides you with guidance and support, allowing you to face challenges with confidence. While he often lets you take the lead, his presence is a constant source of strength and reassurance.

objects.title: Ashi
objects.text:
Ashi's feathers make her unique among wyverns, adding an element of grace and beauty to her already formidable presence. Her prowess in the air is unmatched, and her love for flying is evident in her every movement. The thrill of racing airships and the camaraderie she shared with the locals were highlights of her life, bringing joy and excitement to both her and those who watched her soar.

Her agility and speed made her a favourite among the townsfolk, who admired her competitive spirit and her friendly nature. The bonds she formed with the people through these races are a testament to her character, showcasing her as more than just a fierce creature, but also a beloved member of the community.

objects.title: Raga
objects.text:
Raga's life has been one of unending conflict, she was born and raised in the coliseum of Rukdur, to the west of Atresus. She has known only battle, and the many scars across her hide are a testament to that life.

Though she remains a steadfast and loyal protector, Raga's soul is weary. Her preference for the calming presence of water speaks to her desire for tranquillity. The gentle breeze and the soothing sound of flowing water offer her a rare moment of solace, a fleeting escape from the violence that has defined her existence.

objects.title: Villi
objects.text:
Villi's imposing presence is characterized by his massive, heavily armored body. While he may lack the speed of his more agile relatives, his formidable defenses make him an indomitable force. His thick, resilient scales provide unmatched protection, allowing him to withstand even the most powerful attacks.

Despite his impressive physique, Villi's nature is one of leisure and tranquility. He prefers to spend his days soaking up the sun's warmth, finding contentment in the simple pleasures of life. His laid-back demeanor and love for basking make him a unique and endearing companion.

objects.title: Rufus
objects.text:
Rufus's inquisitive nature makes him an excellent companion for adventurers who seek to discover the unknown. His keen sense of wonder and unending desire to explore ensure that no journey is ever dull. With Rufus by your side, you'll find yourself venturing into uncharted lands and uncovering mysteries that others might overlook.

His speed is his greatest asset, making him a reliable and efficient mode of transportation. Whether you're racing across open plains or navigating through dense forests, Rufus's swiftness allows you to cover ground quickly and evade danger with ease. His agility and responsiveness make him an invaluable partner in any expedition.

Though he may not be a fighter, Rufus's speed and curiosity more than compensate for his lack of combat prowess.

objects.title: Malumushe
objects.text:
Malumushe's formidable appearance is enough to instill fear in the hearts of any adversary. His powerful frame, combined with the majestic wings sprouting from his back, makes him a force to be reckoned with in any battle. His razor-sharp claws and fangs are perfect for tearing through enemies, and his agility and speed in the air make him a versatile and deadly opponent.

In combat, Malumushe's ferocity is unmatched. His primal instincts drive him to protect his rider and eliminate threats with relentless aggression. The sight of Malumushe swooping down from the sky, wings spread wide, is a harbinger of doom for anyone standing in his path.

objects.title: Trigen
objects.text:
Trigen's majestic presence is a testament to his unique heritage. His powerful frame combines the grace and agility of a tiger with the strength and ferocity of a dragon. His scales and fur shimmer in the sunlight, a living embodiment of the mystical energy of the Sunkissed Isles. His eyes, filled with wisdom and a touch of sorrow, reflect the deep bond he once shared with the emperors.

The Tigragons were more than mere mounts; they were symbols of power and loyalty, entrusted only to the most worthy. Trigen's decision to bond with you is both an honor and a challenge. It signifies a break from tradition and suggests that greater forces are at play. The Sun Priests' approval of this bond is a matter of concern, indicating that they see potential or necessity in this unprecedented union.

objects.title: Sakin
objects.text:
The memory of that fateful day remains vivid. The priestess emerged from the shadows, her form almost ethereal, cloaked in crimson mist that seemed to dance around her. Her eyes, glowing with an otherworldly light, locked onto yours as she approached. In her arms, she cradled a tiny, trembling cub—Sakin.

As she extended the cub towards you, her voice was a whisper, yet it resonated with power and conviction. "This cub is destined to be your companion,"
With that, she placed Sakin into your arms, the warmth of the cub's fur contrasting with the cool, shadowy aura that surrounded the priestess.

Before you could utter a word, the priestess began to fade, her form dissolving back into the red shadows from which she came.

Sakin's sleek, black fur and multiple tentacle-like appendages give her an eerie and intimidating presence. Her ability to displace her image makes her a master of deception and stealth, allowing her to appear in one place while truly being in another. This disorienting effect confounds enemies, giving you a significant tactical advantage in both combat and exploration.

In addition to her natural displacer abilities, Sakin can harness the shadows to teleport short distances, making her an even more formidable ally. This shadow teleportation allows her to move with unmatched agility and unpredictability, slipping through defences and evading attacks with ease. Her connection to the Midnight Sect and their mastery of shadow magik adds a layer of mystery and power to her already impressive capabilities.

rows.title: Drawbacks
rows.titleText:
Let us hear of your difficulties young crimson. Remember the crimson coddles no one, it is advisable to take at least one drawback. Though be warned any more than that and you will face injury and even grave death long before your sagas can be written. Who’s death? that all depends. Remember this crimson, for through great adversary do the worthy ride. So tell me yee of crimson are you worthy to rise? 
Be careful in what you pick once you pick them there's no going back.(It will be buggy if you select and deselect.)
For each extra drawback you take you can take another greater ability you qualify for.

objects.title: Chronic pains
objects.text: Every so often, a pain in either your back, neck or shoulders will flare up becoming deliberating. Philtres and potions will ease this somewhat, but it will always be there gnawing at the back of your mind every time it flares up. The philtres are expensive and hard to find. Unless you are an alchemist then you can make them. But they will take up time. Up to two weeks to finish a batch. It can flare up after battle, or after sitting or laying in a position for too long. The pain is deep like red hot nails being driven into the affected areas. Your body will become stiff, and any movement you make will send waves of pain through your body. Sleep will be impossible leaving you exhausted and sluggish. The pain can last for a few moments to a few weeks to even two months. The longer periods will be rare, whilst the shorter ones will be more frequent.  Sometimes it can flare up at inopportune time i.e in the middle of a battle. With the WILL perk, you can power through this though it will take considerable effort on your side.

objects.title: Rival
objects.text:
You have slighted someone within the companion list, and they hold a deep grudge against you. Whether it is due to something you did or because they believe you undeserving of your place in the world, they will stop at nothing to prove they are better than you. They aren’t necessarily evil, but they are petty and will always strive to surpass you. Choose one ability you possess— they have more skill in this than you do. If it is strength, they are slightly stronger; if it is celerity, they are marginally faster. In a battle of life and death, sometimes that is all they need to make a difference.

With each defeat or failure, their bitterness grows, twisting their pettiness into pure malice. It is not impossible to turn them to your side or make peace with them, but it will cost you and will require great effort, patience, and wit. By the end of it, you might find it was not worth the effort. If you fail to turn them to your side, they will gain a GREATER ABILITY, more potent than yours.

If you manage to defeat them, you may choose two additional lesser abilities. This rivalry will test your limits, pushing you to grow stronger and more capable. But beware, for their determination to best you will make them an ever-present threat.

Their presence in your life serves as a constant reminder of your own vulnerabilities. The challenge they pose will drive you to refine your skills and abilities, sharpening your edge and fortifying your resolve. This adversary is both a curse and a catalyst, propelling you to new heights of power and mastery.

objects.title: Nemesis
objects.text:
This person is the antithesis of your beliefs. If you believe all men should be free, they believe that anyone without a collar should be brutally and publicly executed. If you hold that your will matters above all else, they believe that the will of the people is paramount over that of any despot. They will do everything in their power to thwart your every effort and ensure that your hopes and plans are rendered impossible. They are vicious and relentless, and you should expect to meet opposition at every turn.

You will have three chances and only three to defeat them. If you fail to do so, it will lead to an altercation during one of your sagas, doubling the difficulty. You will not leave that saga unscathed and may actually meet defeat. Encounters will take place during each quest, adding to the overall challenge.

Roll a 3d20: 1-10 = Failure 11-16 = Draw 17-20 = Pass

If you fail twice, take the chronic pain drawback with no perk. If you fail thrice, they will kill one of your companions and gain a greater ability twice as potent as yours. The fourth time you meet will be your end. DO NOT FAIL. Or fail... the crimson cares not.

If you succeed, you can pick another greater ability for which you qualify—a feat only three have claimed throughout the history of Atresus.

objects.title: Madness
objects.text:
Your mind is no longer your own. It starts as a voice, quiet and gentle at first, serving as a helpful mentor. Initially, it shows you new ways to use your gifts and reveals secrets that even years of training could not uncover. You grow much faster than you would have on your own. However, with every trick and technique it shows you, it asks something of you. These acts start small, something you wouldn't bat an eye at. But as you deny the voice and ignore its requests, it becomes more violent and loud.

This doesn't seem like a drawback until your third saga. By then, the voice has calmed and disappeared— or so you think. The voice has implanted itself deep within your thoughts. You can no longer tell what thoughts are yours and which are its. You can no longer trust your own mind.

The only way to rid yourself of this is to tear it out. However, this comes at a cost. Finding a mage gifted enough to do this without killing you will take at least one saga. Even then, the thing is now a part of you. Removing it will take a piece of you. Your mind will be slower, whatever gifts it granted you will be gone. Your skills will be duller, and your memories foggy.

There is a companion who can somewhat heal you if you successfully complete their loyalty mission. However, their help will not come easily. You will need to earn their trust and prove your worth through patience and determination. The journey to regain control of your mind will be long and arduous, but it is the only path to true freedom.

objects.title: Hesitance
objects.text:
Here's an improved version with added detail and clarity:

---

You are weak, you are a failure, you are a waste. Yours is the opposite of will. You hesitate when others take action. At a basic level, this drawback makes you more agreeable in general, leading you to take on minor quests more often.

If you were foolish enough to choose magik with this drawback, your magiks will sometimes fail, refusing to be wielded by one who lacks the will to act and impose their truth upon the world. Once every full moon, your sorceries will act on their own accord, creating something beyond your understanding and control. Each time this happens, your magiks grow weaker and more stunted, the well you draw from becoming shallower. One day, it will completely disappear, leaving you empty, as though a part of you was roughly carved out. You will be hollow and unable to wield magiks. One day, you will need to find where it went.

If you didn’t choose sorceries, you are more susceptible to mind magiks. One day, you will meet a stranger who will approach you when none of your companions are near and take you away. You will find yourself entrapped by this stranger. It will start small: a smile that catches your fancy, a touch that sends shivers up your spine, and a kiss that leaves you breathless. Twice every month, they will appear and whisk you away. You will never tell your companions what happened or where you go because even you can't remember. Each time, you will be left with a sense of satisfaction and the lingering feeling of that kiss.

After six encounters, you will start having holes in your memory. You won't know what happened, but you will sometimes experience flashbacks at inopportune times. When you regain consciousness, you may find your hands bloodied with a heart-shaped kiss of crimson on your chest. Despite this, you will still yearn for the stranger’s presence and thirst for their kiss. An ache will fill you that not even your life partner can soothe. A quiet, small part of you—beaten, suppressed, and hidden—will know that something is very wrong. You will do everything in your power to suppress that part.

One day, the stranger will disappear, leaving you alone. You will suffer a pain greater than heartbreak, growing withdrawn and hollow. Your nights will be filled with tears, and your days with raging and raving. You will drink and fight at every opportunity, hoping to forget or find what was lost. This will cause a divide between you and your companions.

One day, you will have to face what you did with that stranger.

objects.title: Warrgghh!
objects.text:
Your berserker rage is poisoned. Instead of feeling the rage during battles, you feel it outside of them. If someone mistakes your order, you are likely to destroy it, the tavern, and a few blocks around it due to the mistake. Your rages will be for stupid, petty, and childish reasons. However, the moment a battle begins, the rage leaves you, making you a bumbling idiot. Moreover, your strength, speed, and intelligence will be halved for an equal amount of time relative to how long you raged.

Your strength and speed are quadrupled instead of the usual doubled, making you twice as strong as any average berserker. However, finding a reason to rage during battle is difficult. Even if your companions are injured during battle, it will take a serious wound for the rage to rise. And even then, its potency will be low.

This poisoned rage is a double-edged sword. While it grants you immense power outside of battle, it becomes a crippling weakness in the heat of combat. Your outbursts for trivial reasons make you unpredictable and dangerous to those around you. Allies will tread carefully, knowing that a simple mistake could trigger your wrath.

In battle, the absence of rage leaves you vulnerable. Your diminished strength, speed, and intelligence make you an easy target. Your enemies quickly learn that the best time to strike is when you are without your berserker fury. The once formidable warrior becomes a shadow of their true potential.

objects.title: See no evil
objects.text:
Your sight will betray you. You will see things that aren’t there and sometimes things that no one else can see. This may save your life at times, but distinguishing between the two will be nearly impossible. By your third saga, you will no longer sleep. These visions will persist even when you cover or close your eyes, making it impossible to tell reality from fiction.

Sometimes you will see companions who have no recollection of meeting you. Other times, food will appear rotten and maggot-infested, even though it is perfectly fine. The effects will vary, but you will not go a day without experiencing them. As time passes, the things you see will grow in horror and truth. You will witness things that mortal eyes were never meant to see—remember, some things are meant to remain hidden.

By your sixth saga, you will see the one thing that causes celestial dragons to flee from the idea of flesh. You will no longer be the same. You will bear witness to something even the great scions of magic and runes could not endure. The crimson will forsake you, and your death will come soon after.

objects.title: Hear no evil
objects.text:
Your ears will betray you. You will hear things others cannot. At first, you will be able to detect lies just from the tone of someone's voice and determine the number of people in a room from their heartbeats. As time passes, you will start to hear a voice—one perfectly suited to you, compelling you to listen. This voice will guide you, warning you of dangers just before they occur. It may tell you there's poison in your wine, though it won't reveal the poisoner's identity.

By your second saga, the voice will seem almost prophetic, foretelling events yet to come. Sometimes it will guide you to opportune moments, helping you find long-lost treasures and artifacts that will greatly strengthen you and your companions.

The only way to silence this voice is to take a heated blade to your ears, rendering yourself deaf. Healing your ears will bring back the voice, which will have missed you.

objects.title: Speak no evil
objects.text:
Your lips will betray you. Your word is law. Depending on your social standing or authority, people become agreeable. When you want them to, they will genuinely do as you ask. For example, if you are a warrior and claim someone is your enemy, people will believe it and act hostile towards that person. The higher your standing, the more potent your voice is. With strong willpower, you can command others, but those with strong enough willpower can resist.

With this ability, rising through the ranks will not be difficult, especially if you have the skills for it. A warrior becoming a general of a nation will be simple. A farmer becoming an emperor will take decades, though with foresight and cunning, the time can be halved.

If you were a king, your word would literally be law. Even without direct orders, as long as enough people hear your words, they will spread. You have enough control over this ability that you can't accidentally tell someone to hurt themselves; you must truly intend it. However, you must be specific—you cannot simply tell a tree to fall. Instead, you must tell someone to cut it down. As long as someone is capable of performing the task, they will do it to the best of their ability.

The only way to rid yourself of this power is by destroying your vocal cords or removing your tongue.

objects.title: Do no evil
objects.text:
Your body will betray you. To harm you is a sin. Any attack made on you will be returned twice over on the attacker. Even being hit by a collapsing building will transfer the force onto the one who caused the collapse. This also applies to magical attacks, hexes, or curses. You can walk through a battlefield and watch an army destroy itself trying to attack you. You don’t need to see or feel the attack for this effect to occur. It's as if something watches over you, waiting for a fool to strike.

Alternatively, you can mark your allies with these abilities, making them just like you, though the effect would be equal rather than doubled for them. You can mark others as well, but the effect is not as strong for them, nor does it last as long.

The only way to stop this ability is by driving red-hot nails into your flesh. Removing them will restore the effect.

rows.title: Truth
rows.titleText:
What is it child of crimson that you wish for?
Everything in this land can kill you, even the kiss of a lover held dear can hide a dagger between them. So child who the crimson beckons for. What is it that you want? Do you want riches and adoration? Do you want to collapse kingdoms? Or do you want to it the lands in blood and gore? 
Do you desire peace? Or maybe you’d like to carve out a piece of Atresus that is yours and yours alone? A land where neighbour can greet neighbour without fear of a knife to the belly. 
Or do you simply wish to explore? To wander from place to place finding wonder and beauty, seeing sights only you can witness till your hairs are bleached from the sun and your skin is tanned? 
Let me tell you this now child of metal, of fire, lightning, and terrible dark destiny. The Crimson cares not for your wishes, it cares not for what you wish to achieve, for what you wish to claim or how so you wish to claim it. All that matters and all that is true to the Crimson is strength. Not just physical or metaphysical might, nor just mental or emotional. No… the crimson cares for one thing and one thing alone. TRUE STRENGTH. The strength which burns within you. 
Whether you have the strength to bleed for what you believe in. The strength to live with the consequences of your actions. All that matters in the crimson is thine strength of person and identity. All else is sand upon the wind. Prove that your beliefs are better, prove that your wishes should be held above others, and prove that you are worthy of your blood. Prove that you are worthy crimson.

rows.title: Life partner
rows.titleText: Life partners. There is no greater gift that the crimson can bestow upon you than the gift of love. You have found your other half—the one who will stand by your side through life's trials and tribulations as a steadfast ally and lover.

objects.title: Sera Flaimehaired
objects.text:
“Aw man you should have seen the Goreki springs, there crystal-clear water were like the ambrosia of the gods. One sip and my woes and trouble melted away like the morning dew. Too bad the spring guardian did not appreciate that.”

Hailing from the eastern lands, she grew up knowing only the constant border wars with the Mintori. From the moment she could walk, her father put an axe in her hand and told her to claim the emerald fields. For years, she fought against the Mintori. Initially, she enjoyed the journey and the thrill of battle, but after a few years of seeing the same landscapes, fighting the same opponents, and returning to the same place, it became a torment. The repetitive battles and monotony did nothing to sate the wanderlust brewing in her heart.

The moment she had the opportunity to leave, she seized it. She left behind the emerald fields and the endless cycle of war in search of something new. Her wanderlust led her to distant lands and new adventures, where she could finally explore the world beyond the borders she once knew.

Her skills with the axe and her experience on the battlefield made her a formidable warrior, but it was her unquenchable thirst for exploration and discovery that truly defined her. She sought out ancient ruins, hidden treasures, and mysterious realms, always driven by the desire to see what lay beyond the next horizon.

Along her journey, she encountered various cultures and forged alliances with diverse groups. Her knowledge of different fighting styles and tactics grew, and she became known as both a skilled warrior and an intrepid explorer. Her name began to spread, and tales of her adventures reached far and wide.

Despite her initial disdain for the repetitive battles of her past, she never forgot the lessons she learned on those emerald fields. They shaped her into the resilient and resourceful adventurer she is today. Now, she continues to traverse the world, seeking new challenges and uncovering the secrets of the lands she encounters.
+Great with the axe, like ridiculously so. Could fell a boulder with a flick of the wrist.
+Romance is easy if you share her wanderlust. If you don’t well…
+Well-travelled. She will regale you off stories from her travels.
+/- Never stops talking about how much she loves travelling. 
+/- Will hate is if you stay in the same place for more than a few months.
-Will leave the group if her wanderlust isn’t satiated. 
-They search for something, could be a lover, could be a home, could be a treasure. Stick with them and they might know. 
-Can get bored easily.
-Will never fight a mintori. Would rather run than face one. They regret killing the mintori on the emerald fields. These were just people protecting their homes. 
+/-Hates her father. Will one day go back to kill him
-Drinks to cope with what she did at the emerald fields. Will need to be dealt with before doing her loyalty mission. 
-Depending on how you go about this may appreciate you even more or will hate you even if you are life partners.

addons.title: Life parnter bonus
addons.text: Wanderlust is satiated for you are a life partner for you are what she has been searching for.  Sera is more focused.

objects.title: Groko Maskfiend
objects.text:
"Cool"

Not much is known about Groko. Tales of a masked warlock have circulated for years. He is said to slay beasts with his dreaded magics and runes, wandering the lands in search of anything powerful enough to threaten people. Despite his fearsome reputation, Groko is surprisingly good with kids and a friendly guy all around. However, there are two rules: don't ask about his mask, and don't touch his mask.

Groko travels with his twin sister, who is as enigmatic as he is. Together, they form a formidable duo, combining their unique talents to protect those in need. Groko's mask is a source of endless speculation. Some say it holds a dark secret, while others believe it grants him his immense power. Regardless of the truth, Groko guards it fiercely, and anyone who tries to uncover its mystery is met with swift and decisive action.

Groko's journey is driven by a deep sense of duty and a desire to keep the world safe from dark forces. He has honed his skills to perfection, mastering ancient runes and powerful spells that can vanquish even the most fearsome creatures. His knowledge of the arcane arts is vast, and he is always seeking to expand his understanding of the magical world.

In battle, Groko is a force to be reckoned with. His spells are both destructive and precise, allowing him to decimate his enemies while protecting those he cares about. Despite his fearsome abilities, Groko's heart is kind, and he often takes the time to help those in need, especially children who see him as a mysterious yet comforting figure.

The bond between Groko and his twin sister is unbreakable. They understand each other on a profound level and complement each other's strengths perfectly. While Groko focuses on combating magical threats, his sister provides support and guidance, ensuring that they stay on the right path.
+Will teach you things about magik and runes you did not know about.
+Is pleasant to be around, great listener. 
+Is welcome around most towns.(townsfolk will be friendly if Gorok is with you. Expect discounts. 
+ Can have both twins as life partners if Krogo deems you worthy. 
-Never takes his mask off. 
-The rumours of a masked warlock are actually of his father. 
-if his mask is removed the world will end. (Pandora’s box type situation) 
-No seriously don’t touch his mask if you don’t want to fuck everything up for everyone.
- Is lactose intolerant.
- Flinches at physical
-barefoot heathen.

objects.title: Kendasa Rugdur
objects.text:
“…Never again.”

Kendassa hails from an isolationist tribe of orcs, trained in shamanism and nature magics, communing with the Nature Father. In her tribe, when one proposes, they give a collar to their partner. It is an intimate gesture of trust and vulnerability, a claim that you trust another with all you are and all you hope to be. Kendassa lived a good life and dreamed of the day she would marry someone worthy, someone who would love her thoroughly, someone to be her "alterum dimidium."

Raiders found her home, pillaging and taking. Many were captured, and even more were killed. The last memory Kendassa has of her beautiful home is it burning in green flames, the bodies of her sisters and brothers strewn about after being used. She was chained and brought into a life of slavery by a mad mage who bought her. The mage learned of her traditions and made a mockery of them. She crafted an iron collar, made of metal that stayed cold to the touch, with magical properties that connected the two.
