Now they were bonded—what the mage felt, Kendassa could feel, and what Kendassa felt, the mage could as well. However, the bond was more one-sided, with the mage having more control.

Using the collar, the mage performed perverse and obscene acts upon Kendassa. The mage was a masochist, enjoying the pain and sensations inflicted on both of them. For years, Kendassa endured this until one day she snapped. All that was left was a briar-encased mage's tower and a corpse surrounded by thorns that bore into its flesh, a metal collar around its neck.

Now free, Kendassa roams the lands, seeking a place to belong and a way to heal from her traumatic past. Her connection to nature remains strong, and she uses her shamanistic abilities to help those in need. Despite the horrors she endured, Kendassa's spirit remains unbroken, and she continues to search for a sense of purpose and belonging.
-Mean as hell, will help people even when they don't want it. Especially when they don't.
-Isolationist prefers to be by herself. Will tend to stay away from other in the crew. 
+Powerful nature magiks.
-If your hand ever goes near her without permission, you will lose both it and the other one. 
+Great healer. Like one of the best.

objects.title: Ishkar
objects.text:
"You go high, I go low?"

Ishkar is one of the lesser-known races from beyond the blighted lands. No one knows who she is or how she got here—not even Ishkar herself. All she remembers is following bloody footprints and a warm presence leading her through the wastes, urging her on. When the orcs from the fringes found a little girl at the edge of the borderland, untouched and unscathed, with faded bloody footprints too big to be hers trailing into the waste, they were unsure of what to do. Any who followed those footprints never returned.

The orcs raised her as best as they could, teaching her honor and ferocity. However, since she had no blood of Ifnar Breachbinder flowing through her veins, she wasn't bound to the land, nor did she have the honor of protecting it. Once she came of age, she left the lands, wandering and learning.

Ishkar is a calm and collected individual. She speaks but often prefers to listen. When she has something on her mind, she doesn't fear bringing it up. She is a proud and strong warrior, her fists akin to steel. Some believe she was blessed with strength. Although she was loved and treated with respect, Ishkar has always felt like an outsider. Because of this, she hasn't been in a relationship. To the border orcs, a relationship is akin to settling down, and none wanted to settle down with one not bound to the land.

Despite her outsider status, Ishkar's strength and resilience are undeniable. Her prowess in combat has earned her respect among those she encounters on her travels. She has become a protector of the weak and a challenger of the strong, always striving to prove her worth and find her place in the world.

It will take some time for her to open up to you. But when she does, expect to be met with a hungry passion that stems from being touch-starved. Her loyalty and dedication to those she cares about run deep, and once she lets someone in, she will fight fiercely to keep them safe.
+Can keep a cool head in the harshest of times
+Her fists hit like three orcs combined
+Can train you in hand-to-hand combat.
+An almost encyclopaedic memory. 
-Distrusts magik and any magik user
-Can be ruthless in battle
-When drunk the idea of personal space is foreign to her.
-Is obsessed with finding the origin of the footprints. Will obsessively search for and collect any information on the footprint. Can be expensive and time-consuming. Expects you to help foot the bill. (make a quest)

objects.title: Finn
objects.text:
"I have many enemies...I wish I didn't."

Finn is a quiet man, his eyes having seen countless horrors and his hands having spilled rivers of blood. He lives a life full of guilt, burdened by the weight of his past actions. A suicidal man, Finn fought everyone he could, believing that one day he would meet his end in battle. That was until he met you. Meeting you brought a spark of light back into his eyes. Though still quiet, he no longer carries that haunted look.

Finn wields dual daggers with deadly efficiency. His skill in combat is unparalleled, making him a lethal opponent. Despite his prowess, he seeks solace rather than conflict, hoping to atone for his past sins.

Your presence has given Finn a renewed sense of purpose. While he continues to struggle with his inner demons, he now has a reason to keep fighting—not just for survival, but to protect and support you. He remains a man of few words, but his loyalty and dedication speak volumes.

Finn's journey is one of redemption and healing. He strives to make amends for his past, and with you by his side, he believes he can find a way to do so. His combat skills, combined with his newfound determination, make him a formidable ally and a trusted friend.

Beneath his stoic exterior lies a heart that longs for peace and forgiveness. Finn's transformation from a man consumed by guilt to one driven by hope is a testament to the power of connection and the strength of the human spirit.

objects.title: Jafar Elferi
objects.text:
"Another round, mon cher."

A hedonist through and through, Jafar indulges in all of life's pleasures and sins to excess. Be it alcohol, money, or extravagance, Jafar's motto is "go big or go home." He approaches everything with the stride of a man who knows exactly when and how he will die—because, sadly, he does. Jafar was promised as a sacrifice to a god of blood and has only two years left before they come for him and demand the offering.

Jafar is a charming rogue with a smile that melts hearts. His charisma is matched only by his zest for life. Despite the looming shadow of his fate, he remains unflinchingly optimistic and lives each day as if it were his last. His infectious enthusiasm and magnetic personality draw people to him, making him the life of any gathering.

Behind his carefree facade, Jafar is a man of deep complexity. He possesses an unwavering courage and a keen intellect, often outwitting adversaries and turning situations to his advantage. His resourcefulness and quick thinking have saved him from numerous tight spots, and he has a knack for getting out of trouble just as easily as he gets into it.

Jafar's impending fate has instilled in him a profound appreciation for the present moment. He cherishes every experience and relationship, knowing that his time is limited. This perspective has given him a unique wisdom and a deeper understanding of the human condition. He is fiercely loyal to his friends and will go to great lengths to protect those he cares about.

Though he embraces life with unrestrained fervour, Jafar also harbours a quiet determination to find a way to escape his grim destiny. He is always on the lookout for ancient texts, forgotten rituals, or powerful artifacts that might offer a glimmer of hope. His quest for freedom is driven by a relentless spirit and an unyielding will to survive.

objects.title: Lika
objects.text:
"You wound me, heart of my hearts."

Lika is an elfen, aloof and airy; she may seem nonchalant, but in truth, she is anything but. Her kind exterior hides a calculating mind. She adores you because you are the first to truly treat her as an equal, and she will do all she can to stay by your side.

Lika's grace and elegance often give the impression that she is detached from the world around her. However, those who know her well understand that beneath her serene facade lies a sharp intellect and a fiercely loyal heart. She is adept at reading people and situations, always thinking several steps ahead.

In you, Lika has found a kindred spirit—someone who sees her for who she truly is and values her for her strengths and weaknesses. This mutual respect has forged a deep bond between you, one that Lika treasures above all else. Her loyalty is unwavering, and she will go to great lengths to protect and support you.

Lika's presence brings a sense of calm and reassurance to those around her. Her quiet confidence and wisdom are a source of inspiration, and her unwavering support makes her an invaluable companion. She may not always show it, but she feels deeply and is profoundly grateful for the connection you share.

With you by her side, Lika feels empowered to face any challenge. Together, you make a formidable team, complementing each other's strengths and compensating for each other's weaknesses. Your partnership is a testament to the power of trust and mutual respect, and it is a bond that grows stronger with each passing day.

objects.title: Frerin
objects.text:
"The emerald fields were once home to me."

Frerin is a minotaur from the emerald fields. He roams the lands, seeking to learn new ways to forge weapons. He speaks plainly and bluntly, and his rough edges often make him come across as rude, especially to humans. Despite this, there is a depth to Frerin that few get to see.

When he met you, something changed within him. He found himself drawn to you, and his feelings grew into love. Frerin now has a new purpose: to forge the perfect armor and weapon for you, a testament to his dedication and affection.

Beneath his gruff exterior lies the greed of an artist who yearns to create a magnum opus. His passion for forging is unmatched, and he tirelessly seeks out rare materials and ancient techniques to perfect his craft. Frerin's dedication to his work is unwavering, and his creations are masterpieces, infused with both skill and love.

Frerin's bluntness can be off-putting to some, but those who take the time to understand him will find a loyal and steadfast companion. He is fiercely protective of his loved ones and will go to great lengths to ensure their safety. His rough exterior hides a caring nature that few are privileged to see.

As Frerin travels and learns, he shares his knowledge with those who are willing to listen. His expertise in weapon forging is unparalleled, and his creations are highly sought after by warriors and collectors alike. Though he may not always show it, Frerin's greatest joy comes from knowing that his work helps protect and empower others.

objects.title: Yalinah Suntouched
objects.text:
"Thank you for showing me the world, my love."

A sheltered princess, she was sent away by her older sister to prevent a succession crisis as turmoil engulfed their lands. Her bodyguards and soldiers were murdered by a group of elemental direwolves, but you saved her. Initially naive to the world, she has grown and learned much through your travels together. Over time, you slowly came to trust and rely on each other.

Her sister, who still cares deeply for her, sends letters to stay in touch and maintain their bond. The princess has become an invaluable diplomat, adept at navigating complex political situations and forging alliances. Additionally, she has mastered the art of rune magic, using ancient symbols and spells to protect and aid your party.

Despite the hardships she faced, her spirit remains unbroken. Her compassionate heart and keen intellect make her a natural leader, often mediating conflicts with grace and wisdom. She treasures the moments you share, cherishing the bond that has grown between you.

When away from the public eye, she drops her mask of leadership, revealing a sweeter and more wondrous side. Her curiosity and genuine delight in discovering new things make your moments together all the more special.

Driven by a desire to see the greater world and explore its mysteries with you, she yearns for adventure and discovery. Her determination to navigate the challenges ahead is matched by her unwavering loyalty to you. She continues to hone her skills, both in diplomacy and magic, always striving to be an asset to your endeavors. Together, you face the challenges ahead with courage and hope, knowing that your love and partnership will see you through even the darkest times.

objects.title: Chadius Von Maximus
objects.text:
"Take that vile creten!"

Oh boy...where do I even begin with this one? Chadius is what you get when you mix a spoiled and rich noble with fairytale knight adventures. Hailing from one of the thriving cities of Atresus, Chadius was raised with a silver spoon in his mouth.

He loves to say embarrassing things like naming his attacks "Giga-Megaton Sword Slash Death Killer" or declaring "A maiden's heart is worth more than life itself." The thing is, he can actually back up his skills. A spellblade of unparalleled prowess, he often flaunts his techniques, shouting their names with all his heart.

Beneath all that false bravado and pretence is a boy with a heart of gold. Coming from a large family where his siblings constantly vied for their parents' attention, Chadius was never deemed worthy. He truly wants to save people and has spent countless hours practising alone in the courtyard.

Finding someone who truly sees him and appreciates him for who he is would help him grow as a person. His genuine desire to protect and help others makes him a valuable ally, even if his dramatic flair can be a bit much at times.

Despite his noble upbringing, Chadius has faced his own share of challenges. His parents' high expectations and constant comparisons to his siblings have made him feel inadequate. This has driven him to train tirelessly, perfecting his spellblade techniques in hopes of proving his worth.

Chadius's love for adventure is matched only by his loyalty to his companions. He is always the first to volunteer for dangerous missions and will go to great lengths to ensure his friends' safety. His unwavering determination and enthusiasm can be inspiring, even if his over-the-top antics sometimes draw exasperated sighs from his teammates.

Though he tries to mask his insecurities with bravado, those who take the time to understand Chadius will find a steadfast friend who is willing to stand by them through thick and thin. His dream is not just to be a hero in tales, but to make a genuine difference in the world, helping those in need and standing up for what is right.
+His favourite attack is named Full Counter where he can return an enemy's attack back at them with twice the intensity.

objects.title: Infrit
objects.text:
"Burn, Baby, Burn!"

Infrit, as she calls herself, was once a normal girl—or at least as normal as one can be with the Archmage of Sengali as her mother. From the start, their relationship was rocky. Where her mother, Amri, was calm and composed, Infrit was fiery and brash. Where Amri was eloquent and a smooth talker, Infrit was loud and blunt. All Amri wanted was for Infrit to learn magic so she could pass on her legacy. However, Infrit had almost no skill with the arcane arts. Her true talents lay in a long-forgotten fighting style, where a warrior's aura could be used to enhance their strength, speed, and durability to superhuman levels.

Ashamed and disappointed, a chasm grew between them. Amri spent all her time with her apprentice, while Infrit was left to her own devices. Eventually, one of the guards took pity on Infrit and taught her to fight barehanded, since she was forbidden from using weapons by her mother.

Whenever Amri and Infrit were in the same room, they would inevitably end up fighting. Finally, Infrit had enough and left. Now she roams the lands in search of adventure—or at least, that's what she claims. In truth, she is searching for a place to belong.

Infrit's journey has made her a formidable warrior. She has honed her skills to perfection, mastering the art of using her aura to enhance her physical abilities. Her fighting style is a dazzling display of strength and agility, leaving her opponents in awe and fear.

Despite her rough exterior, Infrit has a deep yearning for acceptance and understanding. She dreams of finding a place where she can truly be herself, free from the expectations and disappointments of her past. Her fiery personality and indomitable spirit make her a force to be reckoned with, and those who take the time to understand her will find a loyal and passionate ally.
+Her aura manifests as flames, giving her attack fire effects. 
+Almost as strong as someone with the Pankration ability. 
+If you give her a home, she will follow you into hell and back. 
+/-Is passionate as all hell, she will laugh with all her heart or cry with the sadness of a dozen people. 
+She will push you out of your comfort zone and help you become more passionate if you'd like. 
-Your relationship will start off rocky, she will be needy and require a lot of reassurance. 
-She will offer up everything she has in the hopes that you love her. You will need to be patient with her and help her find a healthy way to express her love.

objects.title: Rafeal De Conti
objects.text:
"Kneel or be knelt."

Rafael was born to a family of esteemed knights who believed that duty must come first. Consequently, they spent much of their time traveling to help those in need, leaving Rafael alone as a young child. He learned to cope, believing that his family was out protecting the world, which instilled in him a strong sense of duty and responsibility.

Rafael comes across as cold and stoic, a result of his upbringing and the solitude he experienced. Despite his seemingly detached demeanor, he is a master swordsman and fencer, as well as a great leader and tactician. His skill with the blade is unparalleled, and he has honed his abilities through years of rigorous training and countless battles.

As a leader, Rafael is both strategic and decisive. He is able to analyze situations quickly and develop effective plans of action. His tactical prowess has earned him the respect and admiration of his peers, as well as those who serve under him. He is a natural-born leader who commands authority and inspires loyalty in his followers.

Beneath his stoic exterior, Rafael harbors a deep sense of justice and a desire to protect the innocent. He is driven by the same ideals that his family upheld, and he is willing to make great sacrifices to ensure the safety and well-being of others. His sense of duty extends beyond his personal ambitions, and he is always ready to put himself in harm's way for the greater good.

Despite his many strengths, Rafael struggles with the emotional scars of his past. The loneliness he experienced as a child has left him with a guarded heart, making it difficult for him to form close relationships. However, those who take the time to understand him will find a compassionate and loyal friend who will stand by them through thick and thin.

Rafael's journey is not just one of battles and victories, but also of self-discovery and healing. As he continues to navigate the complexities of his duty and his personal struggles, he seeks to find balance and true purpose in his life.

rows.title: Life partner bonus
rows.titleText: This is a row, and inside of it, you can place choices. On both rows and choices Requirements can be placed, which will block a row from being viewed, or make the player unable to select a choice, depending on either Point-types or the Ids of other choices. Point-types can be made in Features then Manage Points. Hovering over buttons will explain what they do. The Design of the project can be changed in 'Modify Design' at the side navigation bar, and private styling for each row can be turned on in the rows Settings. Default text like this can be turned off in Features -> Manage Defaults.

objects.title: Krogo Maskfiend
objects.text:
Twin sister to Groko. Also wears a mask though their power is tied to it. Face beneath the mask appears to be an abyss. Terrible to look at and will cause nightmares for days if you look into the one golden eye in the middle of her face. Where Groko is kind Krogo is an ass. Will actively work against you until you prove to be worthy standing next to her brother. How you go about this is up to you. Be careful. 
+/-Total ass until they respect you. Then they will kill anyone who looks at you wrong
+Is ridiculously strong can summon defeated foes using shadowy summons from their mask. 
+/- Can create new summons from defeat foes. Though they have to be beasts and not people. 
+/- Romance is incredibly difficult even after proving yourself. Will constantly question if you care about them. Avoid any flirting like the plague.
+/- Must take with their brother. 
-Like a total ass, will sometimes remove the mask just to give you nightmares.
- Is snappy and rude.
-Has to eat defeated foes so as to summon them. DO NOT WATCH. The sounds are enough to make you throw up.
-Touch starved. Will want to be held but will quite literally break your arm if you try to touch her. If she can't, she will stay maskless for two days. Aiming to give either you or your companions nightmares. 
-Will never wear a shoe for the life of her.

objects.title: Choice
objects.text: This is a Choice, and inside of it, you can place images and text. Scores can be added to it, and have Point-types attached. Addons can be added underneath the image and text. In the Functions at the bottom of the choice, there is an array of different things that can be done. Default text like this can be turned off in Features then Manage Defaults.

objects.title: Choice
objects.text: This is a Choice, and inside of it, you can place images and text. Scores can be added to it, and have Point-types attached. Addons can be added underneath the image and text. In the Functions at the bottom of the choice, there is an array of different things that can be done. Default text like this can be turned off in Features then Manage Defaults.

objects.title: Choice
objects.text: This is a Choice, and inside of it, you can place images and text. Scores can be added to it, and have Point-types attached. Addons can be added underneath the image and text. In the Functions at the bottom of the choice, there is an array of different things that can be done. Default text like this can be turned off in Features then Manage Defaults.

rows.title: Life partners, Companions and Rivals
rows.titleText: Throughout your journey, you have encountered many companions, friends, allies and rivals who have enriched your experiences and fought alongside you or against you.

objects.title: Sable the crimson witch
objects.text:
"Let those in-between taste your blood."

Sable is a witch from a tribe of crimson warlocks who use a forbidden technique to power their dreaded magiks. They manipulate the blood in their bodies, causing it to multiply, harden, and purge poisons. They can even eject it to form constructs and other terrifying entities. But Sable's connection to blood magik is deeply twisted, her sanity fractured by a dark ritual forced upon her in her youth.

As a child, Sable was subjected to an agonizing ritual where she was bathed in the blood of a newborn krillin. The ritual was intended to grant her immense power, but it came at a terrible cost. The krillin's parent, upon discovering that their brood had been sacrificed, went on a vengeful rampage, determined to eradicate every last practitioner of the dreaded art. At that point, Sable was already extremely powerful, but even she couldn't stop the massacre. She only intervened when the krillin's fury was directed at her.

The memory of that day is seared into Sable's mind—the sky darkened by the krillin's wrath, its blood-red eyes blazing with fury, and the screams of her fellow warlocks as they were torn apart. Surviving the krillin's wrath, Sable decided to repeat the ritual, further enhancing her abilities. Her magiks are now potent and versatile, allowing her to perform extraordinary feats. The repeated exposure to the krillin's blood has left her physically altered, with crimson veins visible beneath her pale skin burning with a white-hot light, and a haunting, otherworldly glow in her eyes.

Her presence is both a blessing and a curse. While she wields immense power, her mental instability makes her unpredictable and dangerous. The darkness that consumes her mind manifests in her actions—she is needlessly cruel, taking pleasure in the suffering of others. Sable's cruelty knows no bounds, and she will not hesitate to torture for fun, reveling in the pain she inflicts.

objects.title: Gnasher the green lion
objects.text:
"Ey boss, nothin' like der smell of sulfur to get yer up in der mornin'."

Meet Zog, a goblin alchemist with a penchant for chaos and a knack for brewing up all manner of volatile concoctions. Zog left his tribe because he grew tired of being forced to experiment his new potions on the Rattlings—tiny, skittering creatures that never seemed to appreciate his genius.

Zog's manic energy is infectious; he is always in motion, whether tapping his toes, juggling beakers filled with dangerous chemicals, or concocting his next explosive creation. His lab is a whirlwind of activity, with bubbling cauldrons, smoking flasks, and a myriad of strange, glowing ingredients scattered about.

Despite his chaotic nature, Zog has a sharp wit and an uncanny ability to tell the funniest jokes. Many of his jokes are crude and can come off as somewhat ignorant, but his infectious laughter makes it hard not to join in. His sense of humor is a coping mechanism, a way to deal with the constant danger and unpredictability of his chosen profession.

Zog hails from a large family, with ten siblings—a relatively small number by goblin standards. Growing up, he learned to fend for himself and developed a fierce protectiveness over his kin. This protectiveness extends to his friends and allies, and he will not hesitate to kill anyone who gives them trouble.

objects.title: Husher the Everrotten
objects.text:
"Death stalks these somber nights."

Also known as Husher the Unwashed, Suflurpits, Vilestench, and a host of other colorful names, Husher is an assassin like no other. If you pick him, you'll never find a more loyal companion. His steps are silent, his dagger sharp, and his poisons harsh. Since he was a wee little goblin, he trained to be the greatest assassin in the land.

You will smell him long before you see him. Like, seriously—the smoke in the picture isn't smoke; it's his musk. He calls it his 'aura.' It isn't. It really isn't. Husher claims that a witch cursed him, saying that if he ever washed, he would lose his sense of self. The funny thing is, he wasn't actually cursed—at least not magically. It wasn't even a real witch who 'cursed' him. Just some random old hag who didn't like Husher. That didn't stop him from believing he was cursed, and he hasn't washed since.

Husher's peculiar hygiene habits are as infamous as his skills. Despite the overwhelming stench, he is an incredibly effective assassin. His stealth is unmatched, and his ability to blend into the shadows is unparalleled. His daggers are always razor-sharp, and his poisons are expertly crafted to bring down even the most formidable foes.

In his younger years, Husher's training was rigorous and relentless. He honed his skills through countless trials, mastering the art of silent movement and precision strikes.

objects.title: Alabaster Sword Seeks Atonement Through Victory
objects.text:
This is not good. Assattv shouldn’t be here; its presence is an impossibility. The nuclear harpies should be locked away, trapped in their eternal struggle with the quantum dragons. The powerful and eternal dragons you see on our world are nothing compared to the true gods that prowl the far reaches of the universe—makers of suns and worlds your mind cannot hope to comprehend. If Assattv is here, then the implications are dire.

No one knows its reason for being here, and the fact that it is bound to you is never a good thing. The celestial balance is at risk, and the unknown consequences could be catastrophic. The crimson in your veins stirs… in an almost pleased manner, adding to the growing sense of unease.

The nuclear harpies and quantum dragons exist beyond the realm of mortal understanding, their battles shaping the very fabric of reality. For Assattv to escape their grasp and enter our world signifies a breach in the cosmic order, a breach that could unleash untold chaos.

The feeling of dread intensifies as you consider the possibilities. What could have driven Assattv to break free? What force could have compelled it to bind itself to you? The unknowns are as terrifying as the entity itself, and the weight of the situation is almost too much to bear.

The power that courses through your veins, awakened by Assattv's presence, is both exhilarating and horrifying. It responds to the celestial harbinger with a sentient awareness, recognizing a kindred force. Yet, this recognition only deepens the worry. The crimson tide within you is a reminder that you are now part of a grand, unfathomable scheme, one that may lead to either salvation or ruin.

You realize that every step you take, every decision you make, will be shadowed by the looming presence of Assattv. The stakes are impossibly high, and the very fate of the universe might rest in your hands. The implications of this celestial intrusion are beyond mortal comprehension, and the path ahead is shrouded in uncertainty and fear.

objects.title: Zafir
objects.text:
"Seems you and I are becoming quick friends."

You met Zafir in the Djinn-infested deserts, a treacherous place where danger lurks around every corner. At the time, he claimed to be a humble man running a local brothel. One evening, as you walked past his establishment, you noticed a group of thugs attempting to harm one of his workers. Without hesitation, you intervened, saving her life.

Grateful for your bravery, Zafir invited you back to his brothel. That night, he offered you the finest food, drink, and company. The brothel was an opulent establishment, with lavish decor and an atmosphere of indulgence. Once you had your fill of whatever you accepted, Zafir revealed his true identity. He is one of the greatest spymasters in the region, using a network of brothels to collect and sell valuable information.

Impressed by your skills and courage, Zafir offered you a job. The city had become infested with a notorious thieves' guild, and Zafir wanted you to 'take care' of the problem. How you accomplished this task was entirely up to you. Accepting his offer, you set out to dismantle the thieves' guild, using your wit and strength to outsmart and defeat them.

Since that day, Zafir has become your most trusted ally, providing you with crucial information at a fraction of its usual cost. His network of informants ensures that you are always one step ahead, making your missions more successful and efficient. Over time, you have come to respect Zafir not only for his intelligence and resourcefulness but also for his unwavering loyalty.

Zafir's brothel is more than just a place of pleasure; it is a hub of espionage and intrigue. The workers are trained to gather information discreetly, and the establishment serves as a meeting place for various factions and individuals seeking Zafir's services. His influence extends far and wide, and he is known to have eyes and ears in every corner of the region.

objects.title: Oldman Logan
objects.text:
"Come on lad! Don't you know A dragoons weakness is its second stomach."

Once a fearless adventurer who roamed the western side of Astesus, he has seen many battles and fought nearly every beast at least twice. His courage and determination have earned him countless victories and a wealth of experience.

Tall and broad-shouldered, with a weathered face that tells the tale of countless adventures, he cuts an imposing figure. His eyes, sharp and observant, are windows to the many wonders and dangers he has witnessed. A mane of silver hair and a beard to match frame his face, adding to his aura of wisdom and strength.

Now in his twilight years, he enjoys visiting his large family, regaling them with tales of his past exploits. His stories are vivid and captivating, filled with danger, excitement, and the thrill of the hunt. Each retelling brings his adventures to life, inspiring and entertaining his loved ones. Around the hearth, his children and grandchildren listen in awe, hanging on to his every word.

He is an encyclopedia of endemic wildlife, possessing extensive knowledge of the creatures that inhabit the lands of Astesus. His expertise extends to various methods of hunting and butchering wild beasts, skills honed through years of practice and necessity. His insights into the habits and behaviors of these creatures are invaluable, making him a sought-after source of information for aspiring adventurers and hunters.

objects.title: Jack Moonshine
objects.text:
"I wonder...do your lips taste of honey or dates? Better yet will you lend me a taste?"

If a djinn lives long enough, it can gain the intelligence of a human, combining this with their innate shapeshifting abilities. Some djinn choose to live unnoticed within society, blending in seamlessly. However, Jack isn't one of these. She is a half-djinn who inherited more of her mother's genetics but without the inherent shapeshifting abilities. This makes fitting into society somewhat challenging for her, yet she does not care. Instead, she openly flaunts her heritage with pride.
Within Actar, Jack has become somewhat of an icon, if not a living legend. She prowls the desert, fearlessly battling great sand wyrms and protecting caravans, earning her goodwill and respect. Her heroic deeds have solidified her status among the people, but her notoriety extends beyond her bravery.

Jack is also known as the "Ender of Great Bloodlines." She has single-handedly ended the bloodlines of three great houses by seducing half of their heirs. After a night with Jack, these heirs refuse any suitors thereafter and repeatedly attempt to escape their houses to search for her. This, of course, isn't due to any magic—Jack is simply that captivating.

Her actions have not gone unnoticed, and she is now a target of noble houses seeking revenge. Expect to encounter harassed noblemen and heartbroken paramours, each with their own vendetta against Jack. Despite the danger, Jack continues to live life on her terms, embracing her dual heritage and forging her own path in the world.

objects.title: Menso collector of stories.
objects.text:
"Now that was a tale! Why don't I pour you another drink and tell you one better."

Menso's reputation as a resourceful and reliable supplier has earned him the respect and trust of many. His tavern is always stocked with rare and exotic items, making it a popular destination for those seeking unique treasures. However, Menso's services come with a unique twist—if you can regale him with a truly great tale, he will offer you a substantial discount on your purchase.

A master storyteller himself, Menso values the art of narrative and enjoys being entertained by the patrons who frequent his tavern. He has a particular fondness for epic adventures, heartwarming anecdotes, and humorous escapades. The better the story, the greater the discount, making every transaction a memorable experience.

objects.title: Oud
objects.text:
Not much is known about Oud. The shadows seem to lick and curl at their feet. Known as the lone traveler. Not once was Oud seen travelling with another person. That was until they met you. From the moment you met Oud has not left your side. Following you throughout all your adventures. At first you found their constant presence somewhat odd. Especially from the fact they never spoke. Though their body hands and feet would move somewhat randomly at times. But as time moved on you found comfort in their company. Oud was a master of the shadows able to command them as extra limbs or to store objects. In battle, Oud is a shifting mass of dark spikey tendrils each holding a different weapon. From club to spear to sword and crossbow. After weeks together you soon learnt that the movements and twitching of Ouds body weren't a random effect but their way of communicating. After months of study and learning you were finally able to understand Oud. 
+Is a literal demon in battle able to multitask and attack multiple opponents at once.
+Can use their shadows to store your goods and weapons. 
+Is highly mobile when using their tendrils.
-Rarely speaks.
-Is somewhat of a loner. 
-Nights are darker and shadows are longer when Oud is around.

objects.title: Aisha
objects.text:
Aisha currently runs an adventurer's guild while training new recruits. She is also the former lover of Logan.  One of the greatest spear users in the whole nation and could train you in the use of it. Is a charming and charismatic woman. Makes great company. 
+Will make you one of the greatest spear user on the continent if you agree yo train with her for four years. One if you are a wepaonsmaster. 
+Will provide you with the best quests and rewards if you and your companions agree to go on training missions with some of her recruits. 
+Great person to share drinks with. Will help you heal from some of the dark shit you've seen.
-Constantly worries for her son and will always ask for you to keep an eye on him.
-If you travel Njoroge, Aisha will insist on joining you. Njoroge will leave if you agree. 
-Will get bitter and mean if someone mentions Logans name.
-Will initially be hostile with you and you group if Logan is in it.

objects.title: Njoroge
objects.text:
The son of Aisha and Logan. A sword master in his own right. He inherited both his father's sharp memory and his mother's skills. As well as both of their personality traits. Will act as the emotional support for your group. Is an outgoing fellow always pushing to improve himself. Knows many of the adventers on a first name basis.
+Tells the best campfire stories.
+Is skilled with the sword.
+Can make the best out of any situation.
+Will push you and your companions to train and improve with him.
+An natural born leader. If leader you will find your fame growing as well as your skill. 
-If your are the leader will fight you for the right to lead. Not because of any malice but because he truly believes himself to be best suited for the job.
+If able to prove that you are the better leader. You will find in him a loyal and steadfast second in command. Following even your vaguest of orders and bringing the best out of them.
-Sometimes pushes himself and your group too far when it comes to training. Though will be easy to rear him down if you have proven yourself.
-Has a poor relationship with his father, and will kick him out fo the group if he part of your crew. If not he will leave himself. 
-Avoid his mother like the plague. Making getting information or training from her difficult.

objects.title: Ogun the Bulwark of Machakos
objects.text:
Ogun the bulwork of machakos. Contrary to his looks Ogun plays more of a support role than as a warrior. He mainly focuses on buffs and debufs. He was once known as the greatest supporter and had whole adventure guilds begging him to join them.  
Ogun got his name from an adventure of his. Where he used every single buff and debuff to his name against and army of three hundred. A feet thought impossible for a support role. 
For three nights and four days, Ogun held a single narrow mountain pass as the women and children of his hometown were evacuated. 
Though he was able to hold them off until his peoples allies arrived it came at a grave cost. 
By the end of your sagas, Ogun is guaranteed to die. His body has come to rely on the buffs he constantly feeds it. Without it, his bones will collapse under the weight of his muscles. His organs crushed and his skin torn.
+/- Buffs and debuffs are only half as effective since he uses the remaining on himself. 
+Buffs/skills are still a cut above the rest. 
+Cooks the healthiest and most nutritious meals that will leave you refreshed and energised. 
-Need to be defended during fights.
-Hates elfens with a passion. Will not travel with you if you or your companions are elfen. 
-Might kill you and your companions if either of you are elfen.

objects.title: Grevin
objects.text:
Grevin an undead litch. One of the best magik users on the continent. Was once hailed as the second coming of Ottar the foul. Had planned a rebellion, starting his own dark religion and spreading magic amongst his country men. Which was considered a great tabboo. A war so great almost brought the downfall of his people. After winning Grevin surrendered the throne and spent many lifetimes rebuilding his home and his people. Banning magik once more.But that was all in his youth. Now he is a husk of a man, full of regret and sorrow. Wishes to to do something right with the remainder of his life. Has three daughters two of which he abandoned with their mothers. Believing he would only hurt them if he stayed to raise them. 
+Mastered curses and hexes
+Will show you long-forgotten magiks if you have a knack for them.
+Is a fierce warrior and can train you to be even greater.
-Has grown tired of fighting and will never do so.
-Is a serious vibe kill.

objects.title: Narrak
objects.text:
Narrak is a rogue and a bard. Able to charm the pants of off almost anyone. Hell, most will offer their shirts too if they could. Fun-loving and will bring an air of lightheartedness throughout most of your adventures. Will never talk about her self. 
+Has a kick that could dent armour.
+Plays almost every instrument. 
+Will southe you and your companions after long journey. 
-Is a cleptomaniac who will constantly steal things from you, your group, townfolks and almost anyone in her near vicinity. 
-This can bring about unwanted attention and create tension within your group.

objects.title: Karana Allender
objects.text:
Karana is the eldest sister and daughter of Grevin. Karana from birth was trained in nothing but war by her mother. Learning everything from leadership to guerilla tactics to single combat. Her mother had hopes of using her as a weapon to accomplish what her father failed to do long ago. She never had time to do anything but fight and thus struggles with anything not related to war. A warrior first a person second.  Hates her mother and father and is jealous of her sister Kinami who was raised by her father. She always dreamt of her father coming to rescue her from her mother but he never did.
+Is a weapons master in her own right. 
+Can fight a whole army with nothing but cowards and thieves and still wind up on top. Though with serious casualties. 
+Is an edge lord to the max. Says stuff like "Oh death be my sword once more"
-Can be cruel to companions.
-Is somewhat of a sadist.
+Underneath all the cruelty and self-loathing is a woman who has never known love and has been treated as nothing but a weapon for most of her life.
+If you can help her face her traumas, she will become your most passionate warrior and or lover. 
-Has spilt more blood than you can imagine.
-Is plagued by nightmares of her past actions. 
-If not helped will turn to alcohol and drugs as a coping mechanism.

objects.title: Monolith
objects.text:
Monolith is a creation of the old ones. A golem made of a mixture of metal and stone. Monolith is a quiet defender, and known as the defender of the weak. WOuld move from town to town village to village defending them from monster attacks. He would settle for a year before moving on. The cloth and jewellery covering him were gifts given to him by those he defended.  One day he helped you defeat and thunder bird terrorizing a small town. After a year he found you and has stuck with you since. A master earth elemental. 
+Can move boulders the size of houses with ease.
+Can learn some intricacies of earth magic if you are magickly inclined.
+Villages and towns it saved will hail you as a hero, giving you discounts and free lodging and meals.
+/- Will not ally with you if you harm the weak. May kill you if you do. 
+/-Very difficult to put down.
+Cannot speak.
-Is very heavy and moves slowly. 
-Has trouble entering normal buildings or houses. 
-Will follow your orders to the letter. You need to be very specific.
-Need to recharge once every year. It is highly vulnerable.

objects.title: Kisari Valekin
objects.text:
Kisari the second eldest sister. Also known as the death of silence. One of the greatest assassins of the elfen empire. Trained by the oldest of masters to be the fiercest blade to the throne. As her final test, she was ordered to kill them. The same people who raised and trained her. 
Unlike her eldest sister, she enjoyed it. Is the current assassin to the elfen queen, Karanas mother. Who owns her leash. 
+Femme fatale personality.
+A fantastic actor and can disguise herself as almost anyone. 
+Her steps are so silent and light to the point that she can use leaves as stepping stones. 
+None can hear her approach. 
-Enjoys killing.
-Takes her time in killing her enemies. 
-Has murdered more people than her two sisters combined. 
-Will oneday kill her sisters and father. For no other reason other than to test herself. 
+/- Can be stopped as long as you can prove to be worthy of holding her leash.

objects.title: CHCHCHC
objects.text:
Named after the sounds she makes when she's pleased. No one knows what she actually is. She was found in the basement of Wizards Tower, which for some reason or another just disappeared. Leaving a basement of horrors and an interdimensional portal the local militia with the help of you and your companiosn. Upon defeating monster horde after monster horde eldritch horror. All that was left behind was her. Of course you chose to do the most reasonable thing and adopt her. Eats anything an everything though for some reason she prefers warm-blooded animals. 
+Is one of the few creatures that can contend with the celerity blessing.
+Loyal 
+Can track anything as long as its on the same continent
+Has the intelligence of a somewhat intelligent bloodhound. 
+Claws can tear through armor
-Vicous to strangers.
-Overheats after running to much. 
-Doesn't do well in cold climates.
-If left to her own devices will hunt the local wildlife to extinction.

objects.title: Wraka
objects.text:
"Wraka misses the cold and lonely nights beneath the waves."

Atresus is home to a multitude of races and their offshoots. Many of these races reside in hard-to-find, often isolationist locations, making information about them scarce. Wraka hails from the depths of the ocean, and unlike what most might think, he is amphibious and quickly adapted to life on land.

Wraka's skin is rough like sandpaper, and he usually does his best to keep it moist. Due to the pressures of the deep ocean where he lived, Wraka is many times more durable and stronger than an average human.

He spends most of his time traveling and enjoying the cuisine of various cultures. Although he is a trained fighter, Wraka will serve more as a scribe and stores manager for your group, keeping everyone well-fed and maintaining your armors in peak condition. His extensive travels also make him a great guide, pointing out wonderful stops along your journey.
+Very wodlry. 
+You won't have to worry about rations
+An excellent fencer. 
-Will insist you go out of your way to see certain things. Will add days if not weeks to some of your adventures.
-Is a bit of a miser, expect your group funds to be tightly guarded.

objects.title: Brunhilda
objects.text:
"May Taloks mercy shepherd your soul into the land after."

Brunhilda is what most would consider a paladin, adhering to a strict oath of no killing. However, she has found a loophole in this oath and will not hesitate to use it if she deems someone irredeemable. She is kind, but not to a fault.

Acting like the big sister of the group, Brunhilda keeps everyone from slitting each other's throats and helps calm the more excitable members. She ensures that they stay in line, to an extent.

Her tools of trade are the spear and shield. 

Little is known about the deity she worships, Talok. The form of worship Talok demands is unique to each individual. Some followers take long pilgrimages to spread Talok's words, others take vows of silence, and some hunt down the vilest individuals, ensuring they suffer before granting them Talok's mercy. All these forms are valid. Followers often say that you'll know what Talok wants from you when you do it. Brunhilda describes this as "A gentle yet firm hand on her shoulder that guides her."
+Will act as tank and healer of the group. 
+Kind and supportive. 
+Makes the meanest shepherd's pie. 
-Will often preach
-Will often question your motives if they involve too much violence.
-Will often try to convince your group to convert.

objects.title: Kirika
objects.text:
"So how does a thousand years of service as my footstool sound?"
The youngest of three sisters, Kirika was the favourite of Grevin. Unlike her sisters, her mother was neither an assassin nor a great Warmaster. Instead, she ran a humble inn, where travelers would come to rest by the fire and enjoy hot food. Kirika spent most of her time there, hoping to pick up the trade and allow her mother to rest.

The inn was burned to the ground by a roving band of mercenaries, and Kirika would have died that night had her father not intervened. Her mother perished in the flames, and Grevin was forced to adopt her. He raised her in a cottage far from the inn, where he taught her magic. To his silent dismay, Kirika inherited his talent for the dark arts. Despite the tragedy of her mother's death, Kirika retained her joy and tenderness. She learned magic to bond with her father and to keep him around.

Once she had learned all she could, Grevin left. Now, Kirika travels the land, taking down rogue mercenary groups and searching for her sisters.
+Second greatest necromancer keeps the souls of those she's skilled. Has a literal army of the dead at her beck and call. 
+/- Requires a lot of energy to bring them out, if you were to find a large enough energy source, summoning a legion of ghostly warriors would be simple.
+Considered a folk hero by some. 
+Can teach you simple hexes and curses. Even if you aren't magikly blessed. 
-Will insist you spend most of your time hunting rogue mercenary groups.
-Detests mercenaries and mercenary work.

objects.title: Raku Raku
objects.text:
"We can leave now and beat Jacobo to the Manzi ruins."

Raku Raku, or RR as his friends call him, owns the largest airship fleet on this side of Atresus. While his sister built the airships, it was his genius and shrewd business mind that led them to riches and success. He is currently funding his sister's next big invention.

RR will ensure that all your adventures are traveled in comfort and luxury by providing you with your very own airship—a prototype his sister has been working on for decades. The airship is big enough for you and your companions to travel comfortably, yet small enough to be maintained with just your companions and a pilot/mechanic, provided by Raku Raku.

Of course, his sister will expect detailed reports on the ship, and she prefers if you keep it out of international incidents.

Raku Raku will join you on some of your adventures but usually takes a backseat approach, preferring to see how things play out before acting.
+/-Dry humour.
+Will help you get into cities lowkey. 
+Knows every trade route by heart. 
+Will get you the best discounts.  
-Is a bit of a pervert.
-Is a smuggler fo contraband materials, expect your airship to be attacked by assassins and thieves searching for RR. 
-Will often disappear into brothels.
-Cannot breathe without the mask, due to an accident in his youth. 
-If the mask comes off even once, he will die. His sister will blame you. Taking away your airship privileges.

objects.title: Watin
objects.text:
"Watch this!"

Watin is the best airship pilot to ever grace the skies of Atresus. His unparalleled skill, quick decision-making, and flashy maneuvers will ensure you reach your destination—even if it means flying through a celestial storm while your ship is infested with flesh-eating harpies. By his hand, you will reach your destination, though you may or may not be missing a few appendages.

Watin often pushes your airship to its limits for the sole reason of "seeing how he sings." He will dub your airship "Jimbo" and care for it as though it were his only son. This won't stop him from testing its limits and redlining it as often as he can get away with.
+/- Is an adrenaline junky. Expect some of your flights to be fast-paced. 
-Often does risky maneuvers that can have you throwing up.
-Makes the worst puns. 
-Somewhat of an alcoholic in his free time.

objects.title: Yagna stormseer
objects.text:
"I've seen the world end in every way possible. In three-quarters of those, you were right in the middle of it. In the other quarter, you were at the helm, leading us to certain doom."

The day you met Yaga, you mistook her for a fortune teller. She had a small shop that served tea. When you walked in, her eyes widened, and a cup slipped from her fingers, shattering at your feet. She quickly left in a hurry. Later, while you were browsing the market stalls, the royal guard surrounded you and your companions and guided you to the royal castle. There, you were treated like royal guests but always under the watchful eyes of guards.

After a week of this drudgery, you finally grew tired of the wait. Just as you were about to free yourself and your companions, the queen invited you into her sanctum. The invitation was for you alone.

There, the queen revealed the truth. She was once a seer of great power but had peered too far into the future and lost her ability to see it. However, before her vision faded, she saw multiple futures where the world ended, and more often than not, you were the cause. For the past week, she had debated whether to kill you or not. If not for her apprentice, she would have. He argued for your life, claiming that in at least half of his visions, you were the sole reason they had a chance at preventing the end of the world.

Queen Yaga decided that you would travel with her apprentice. He will monitor you, and if you ever prove to be the end of the world, he will not hesitate to kill you.
+Gain Ivory as a free companion. 
+/- She will not travel with you however she will provided you with a writ, this will only save you from the law once. 
-She is a powerful queen and her infulence reaches. If you want to do anything she doesnt aprove of don't she will know.

objects.title: Ivory
objects.text:
"The path you chose is littered with the corpses of those that came before you."

Ivory is the queen's first and last apprentice, and the only man to have seen the face of a dragon. He blinded himself soon after, tearing out his own eyes and placing hot coals in the empty sockets. On nights when the moon is gone, an eerie orange glow can sometimes be seen emanating from his closed eyelids.

His skill with prophecy is unmatched. Noen have even a fraction of his talent. 

Ivory occasionally warns you when you're about to make a crucial decision, though you won't always understand what the decision is. It could be as simple as turning left instead of right, finishing half your meal and discarding the rest, or deciding to sleep in. You'll never know, and he will never tell. 
+Is a powerful anti mage, he can unravel a spell the moment it is sent his way.
+A talented spear user trained by Aisha himself. 
+Has the ability to see the future.
+is the worst person to fight, knows your every moves long before the fight has started.
+He will always maneuver himself into the most ideal situation or spot, effortlessly avoiding a dagger as easily as finding a rare treasure map. 
+Has wonderufl singing voice known. Will sometimes sing to relax your group. 
+Will sometimes do things that seem out of place. Though they will always benefit you.
+Will freely give advice.
-Advice is criptic as hell.
-Always watching you. 
+/-Though he is the queens spy, his loyalty deosnt belong to her.

objects.title: Revy SIlvereye
objects.text:
"Ha I knew Koroka's horde wa sin the Jumani dunes! You owe me a tenna, make sure to pay up when we find the horde. "

Revy is the best treasure hunter Atresus has ever known. If it existed on a map, Revy will find it, no matter how long it has been. She can lead you to the deepest ruins, help you clean out every tomb, and have you back just before tea time. Her wit is sharp, her laugh boisterous, and her pockets generous. A large portion of her fortune funds orphanages.

Revy will expect you to stop at some orphanages occasionally, helping to teach the children a thing or two or just generally lending a hand. She is a good friend of both Zafir and Menso.

+Your journey will be well funded. 
+Expect every treasure hunt of yours to be more profitable.
+Will give you a fair share.
+Her maps are detailed and clean. Making your journeys more efficient.

objects.title: Konu Raftah
objects.text:
"So this question is completely hypothetical, but just for humour's sake... how long would I have if I stole from the red noble we just saved?"

You met Konu while he was being chased by the city guards. After saving him and convincing the guards it was all a big misunderstanding, they left. That's when you noticed your coin pouch was missing and Konu was nowhere to be seen. Finding him was a nightmare, but you eventually did—in a prison cell. Saving him was more trouble than it was worth, but you did it. Konu promised to show you where a rare alchemical ingredient grew.

Since then, Konu has been by your side. Expect any of your adventures involving stealing or breaking and entering to be much easier. His quick wit and nimble fingers make him an invaluable asset in tight situations. He's skilled in lock-picking, sleight of hand, and has an uncanny ability to blend into the shadows.

Konu also has a knack for gathering information. He's well-connected in the underworld and can often provide you with useful intelligence about potential targets or adversaries. Though he can be a bit of a wildcard, his loyalty to you has never been in question since you saved him.

However, his mischievous nature means you'll need to keep a close eye on your belongings, as old habits die hard.
+Master at sleight of hand.
+Can talk his way out or into trouble.
+Funny as hell. 
+Master lockpicker. 
+/-Can break into anywhere, escaping is the problem. 
-Major cleptomaniac.

objects.title: One
objects.text:
+Carries insane and powerful technology within it. Could take on an army solo.
+Can forge any melee weapon you could imagine at of almost anything. 
+Will keep your equipment in peak condition 
+Dissapears for weeks at a time, fulfilling some unknown directive. 
-Speaks through whirs and clicks. 
-Watches what you and your team does. 
-Sometimes in the middle of the night, you will find it stark still. Staring up and into the sky as a blue light envelops it. The clicks it will make will be clearer and almost legible. Do not let it catch you. 

DO NOT 01110100 01110010 01110101 01110011 01110100 00100000 01101001 01110100 00001010

objects.title: Roke
objects.text:
"..."

No one knows what Roke truly is—a nature golem, a green knight, or the shadow of a dead god. What you do know is that it possesses innate control over nature magics. Wherever Roke walks, flowers bloom, trees grow, and vines seem to reach out to touch him.

Roke's passive aura revitalizes and heals you and your companions, providing a constant source of renewal and energy. This aura also has a calming effect on the environment, often pacifying aggressive creatures and fostering harmony in nature.

Roke's origins are shrouded in mystery, and its true purpose remains unknown. However, its presence is a blessing to your group, offering protection and sustenance. With Roke by your side, you can traverse the wildest terrains and face the harshest conditions, knowing that nature itself supports you.

Beyond its healing abilities, Roke can manipulate the natural world to create barriers, summon creatures, and even control the weather to some extent. Its connection to the earth is profound, making it an invaluable ally in both battle and exploration.
+Nature becomes your ally.
Animals will lead you to places to seek shelter or drink fresh water. 
+Passivley heals you and boosts your body's immunity. 
+Constant supply of food as whatever trees around him will bare fruit.
+/- Is very protective of plant life in general.
-Extreme pacifist. 
-Will leave if you or your companions know any pyro magic.
-Will refuse to enter cities.

objects.title: Gregory Abadon
objects.text:
"Grunt..."

Gregory has singlehandedly caused the extinction of many goblin clans in the east of Atresus. A xenophobe and prickly old bastard, he will do almost anything to ensure every goblin he encounters is either dead or leading him to more he can kill. The reason behind his relentless crusade remains a well-kept secret. Some speculate he lost his family to goblins, others believe they kidnapped his daughter. Whether any of these rumors hold truth is another story altogether.

Gregory's hatred for goblins has made him both feared and reviled. Despite his abrasive nature, he is an experienced and skilled warrior, often taking on missions no one else would dare to accept. His tenacity and ruthless efficiency have earned him a reputation as a goblin-slayer, though he rarely speaks of his past.

Any inquiries about his past are usually met with a dismissive grunt, but on a bad day, prying into his history might cost you a few fingers. His demeanor is tough and uncompromising
+Knows almost every counter to an alchemical poison made by goblins.
+Knows how to counter their magiks. 
+One of the best trackers and hunters.
+Would make a killing out of bounty work if you convinced him to change up his prey.
-Is a seriously messed up guy. 
-Enjoys killing goblins way too much, and is sadistic in his methods. 
-Any goblin companions will leave if you join up with him. 
-You and your group will me made an enemy of every goblin tribe within Astresus.

objects.title: Rikan Unrivaled swordsaint
objects.text:
"Its a sword."

Rikan is one of the few people in this age to attain the title of Sword Saint. Of course, the weapon she wields isn't a sword but a spear—just don't tell her that. A student of Aisha and a rival to Ivory, Rikan is a firecracker of a person with a vibrant personality and fiery determination.

Rikan has mastered wind magiks, enabling her to cut enemies from leagues away with a mere flick of her spear. Her swift and precise movements make her a formidable opponent on the battlefield, often leaving her adversaries in awe and terror. Her connection with the wind also grants her incredible agility and speed, making her almost untouchable.

Rikan's fierce rivalry with Ivory pushes her to continuously improve and hone her skills. She thrives on challenges and is always eager to prove herself. Despite her competitive nature, she is fiercely loyal to her friends and will go to great lengths to protect them.

Her unorthodox choice of weapon has led to many underestimating her, but Rikan takes great pleasure in proving them wrong. She is not just a warrior but also a strategic thinker, often coming up with innovative tactics that turn the tide of battle in her favour.
+Master spear user and tactician. 
+Has reputation that will open some doors, and shut others. 
+Laid back outside of battle.
-Often gambles her money away. Leading her to often pester you into lending her money.

objects.title: Rusher
objects.text:
"You think he'll mind if I take his toes."

Unlike most goblins, Rusher mastered shaman magics instead of alchemy. His proficiency with hexes and curses makes him a formidable enemy. His magics often act as debilitating debuffs, weakening his foes in various ways.

Rusher's expertise in shamanistic arts allows him to manipulate the elements and spirits, often turning the tide of battle in his favor. He can summon spirits to aid him, cast protective wards, and invoke powerful curses that sap the strength and vitality of his enemies. 
Though he is feared and respected among goblins, Rusher's unorthodox path has set him apart, earning him a reputation as a loner and an outsider. Nevertheless, his skills are unmatched, and those who underestimate him do so at their peril.
+The spirits of the wild often, do him favours. Can put in a good word for you. 
+Knows a lot of forgotten spells, would make a great teacher. 
-Has the unhealthy habit of eating the remains of his foes.
-Makes sure he stays away from the cookfire. 
-Seriously ensure he never steps near it.

objects.title: Fangna
objects.text:
"Mine..."

"Don't look her in the eyes" is a phrase you'll often hear when she's near. A 9ft tower of rippling muscle and razor-sharp tusks, Fangna is one of the few orcs you'll see miles away from the borders. Orphaned at a young age, she was raised by an infamous mercenary group who knew nothing about raising an orc. As a result, the only thing she learned from them was that might makes right.

She will often push this ideology against you and your group, imposing her will on those around her. If you cannot prove yourself stronger, your adventure may not last long.
+Is ridicoulsyl strong. 
+Will act as the muscle of your group.
+Will never hesitate if your orders involve some sort of violence.
+Has multiple mercenary contact, willing to do almost anything for the right price. 
-Half of this will betray you for a larger some, the other half want her dead.
-If an adventure doesnt require violence, she will go out of her way to involve violecne in some way.
-Constnantly picks fights with you, your companions and anyone near her.

rows.title: Rivals(WIP)
rows.titleText: Rivals. Every two rivals you take is an extra companion. If taken without the drawback you must take four. Can provide extra flavour to some encounters.

objects.title: Berk-say-sum
objects.text:
"Weak, you're so fucken weak!" 

Berk-say-sum's voice booms with disdain, his words cutting through the air like a blade. His unparalleled strength is not just a physical attribute but a cornerstone of his identity. He revels in his power, using it to his full advantage as hired muscle for nobles and crime syndicates alike. This lifestyle of power and influence fuels his hedonistic tendencies, allowing him to indulge in the pleasures that come with his reputation.

Berk-say-sum's ego is as immense as his strength. He thrives on proving his superiority, often challenging others to physical contests to assert his dominance. His relentless drive to demonstrate his might has made him a bitter rival to many, including you. The constant need to prove himself creates an air of tension and rivalry whenever he is near.

His taunts are not just words but a reflection of his deep-seated need to assert his dominance. Each challenge he issues is a test, a way to measure his strength against others and reaffirm his place at the top. His disdain for weakness is palpable, and he takes every opportunity to belittle those he deems inferior.

Despite his antagonistic nature, Berk-say-sum's skills and abilities cannot be underestimated. His sheer strength and combat prowess make him a force to be reckoned with, and his presence is both intimidating and awe-inspiring. His relentless pursuit of dominance drives him to push his limits, constantly seeking new ways to prove his superiority.

objects.title: Yaksha Sunpriestess
objects.text:
"Yours is a stain upon the royal the royal family. I will gladly clense you with the emprors holy flame."

Yaksha's distrust of you is palpable. She uses her considerable influence to hinder your journey at every turn, creating obstacles and challenging your progress. Her motivations are deeply rooted in her devotion to the royal family and the traditions of the Sunkissed Isles.

If you have bonded with Trigen, the dragon-tiger hybrid, Yaksha sees it as an affront against the royal family. The bond between a Tigragon and someone outside the royal lineage is unheard of, and to Yaksha, it represents a breach of tradition and an unacceptable challenge to the established order. She perceives your connection with Trigen as a threat and will stop at nothing to bring you down.

Yaksha's solar-based abilities grant her formidable powers, making her a dangerous adversary. Her mastery of light and heat allows her to create blinding flashes, scorching rays, and protective barriers. Her presence is both commanding and intimidating, as she harnesses the sun's energy to achieve her goals. However, she prefers to use her solar abilities in service of the royal family, ensuring their protection and maintaining their supremacy.

As you navigate your journey, Yaksha's relentless efforts to thwart you will be a constant challenge. Her unwavering loyalty to the royal family and her determination to uphold tradition make her a powerful and determined foe. The path ahead will require you to confront Yaksha's influence and find a way to overcome the obstacles she places in your way.

objects.title: Frinek Silvertooth
objects.text:
"By my papi's gold teeth! You make this sooo easy, you know that?"

Con artist, swindler, lousy good-for-nothing—these are just a few of the names people use to refer to Frinek. He is a master con artist, always ready to swindle you out of your hard-earned money. Even when you think you've got him cornered, he'll always have a way out. Frinek's skills in deception and trickery are unparalleled, making him a formidable opponent in any game of cards or similar pursuits.

Frinek's charm and wit are his greatest assets. He can easily win over unsuspecting victims with his smooth talk and convincing demeanor. His ability to read people and situations allows him to exploit weaknesses and manipulate outcomes to his advantage. Whether it's a friendly game of cards or a high-stakes gamble, Frinek always has a trick up his sleeve.

Frinek's backstory is a blend of hardship and resilience. Growing up in the streets, he learned early on that survival depended on his wits. The harsh realities of his upbringing molded him into the cunning individual he is today. Despite his dubious methods, Frinek sees himself as a survivor, using his skills to navigate a world that has never been kind to him.

Frinek's con artistry extends beyond simple card games. He's adept at orchestrating elaborate schemes, using a network of contacts and accomplices to execute his plans. His operations are meticulously planned, with contingencies in place for every possible outcome. This level of preparation ensures that even if his initial con fails, he always has an escape route.

objects.title: Raisha
objects.text:
Raisha's cunning and intelligence are key to her success. She is a master manipulator, adept at reading people and exploiting their weaknesses. Her ability to navigate the complex web of politics allows her to secure valuable information and influence, all while maintaining her cover as a desirable socialite.

Her dual life is a delicate balancing act, requiring her to constantly shift between her roles. As a priestess, she is deeply committed to the Cult of Night, performing rituals and guiding its members. As a political player, she is charming and enigmatic, always one step ahead of her adversaries.

Raisha's presence is both captivating and dangerous. Her beauty and allure are weapons in her arsenal, used to disarm and manipulate those around her. However, beneath the surface lies a calculating and ruthless strategist, dedicated to advancing the cult's agenda.

Her actions have far-reaching consequences, shaping the political landscape and furthering the Cult of Night's influence. Raisha's ability to blend into high society while serving a darker purpose makes her a formidable force, one that few can resist or even recognise until it's too late.

objects.title: Mayin
objects.text:
"They should be with me! NOT YOU!"

Mayin, the playboy extraordinaire, is notorious for coming between couples. His motivations are driven by a deep-seated greed and a profound sense of hate, stemming from never having experienced true love at first sight—until his eyes landed on your life partner. Consumed by his desire, Mayin will stop at nothing to win them over, seizing every opportunity to wedge himself between you.

It begins subtly, with charming compliments and gifts of flowers meant to captivate your partner's attention. As his advances are repeatedly rebuffed, Mayin's tactics grow more desperate and audacious. He employs his skills as a master sorcerer, weaving intricate illusions of sight and sound to create confusion and doubt.

Mayin's manipulation extends far beyond mere flirtation. He orchestrates scenarios that make you question your partner's loyalty, planting seeds of mistrust and discord. His charm and cunning allow him to navigate social circles with ease, turning allies into unwitting pawns in his pursuit. Each encounter with Mayin feels like navigating a treacherous labyrinth, with every twist and turn designed to undermine your relationship.

The culmination of Mayin's obsession is the kidnapping of your life partner, a bold move that forces you into a perilous rescue mission. His illusions create a world of shifting realities, where nothing is as it seems, and danger lurks around every corner. The stakes are higher than ever, as you must rely on your wits and determination to save your partner from Mayin's grasp.

Mayin's relentless pursuit is fueled by his twisted desire to experience the love he has always been denied. His actions are a dark reflection of his longing, a desperate attempt to fill the void within him. The path to rescuing your life partner is fraught with challenges, as Mayin's illusions and deceptions test your resolve and ingenuity at every step.

objects.title: Vrim
objects.text:
"Where is your rage little desert mouse? Where is your fury?"

Vrim is a six-armed and four-legged djinn, revered in some cities as a spirit of war and vengeance. His imposing figure is adorned with countless scars, each one a testament to the innumerable battles he has survived. His body is a living canvas of combat, bearing the marks of clashes that have shaped him into the formidable entity he is today.

Vrim's presence is inescapable, especially whenever you show signs of improvement. Every time you learn a new technique or skill, he materializes to challenge you, his piercing eyes fixed on you with an intensity that borders on the predatory. Denying his challenge is not an option, as he will target your teammates, forcing you to confront him to protect those you care about.

The battles with Vrim are grueling tests of endurance, skill, and strategy. His immense strength and mastery of weapons make him an opponent of unparalleled difficulty. Each of his six arms wields a different weapon, each movement a symphony of lethal precision. His four legs give him an unshakable stance, making it nearly impossible to topple him.

Victory against Vrim comes with rewards that go beyond mere accolades. When you manage to defeat him, he offers to teach you a new skill or help you refine your existing abilities, his begrudging respect evident in his gruff demeanor. His teachings are hard-earned and invaluable, pushing you to levels you never thought possible. However, should you fail, Vrim claims a weapon or item of yours, a stark reminder of the price of defeat.

Vrim's twisted sense of honor is both a curse and a blessing. He will sometimes save you from certain death, claiming that your life will not end until you surpass him. This strange form of protection means that he sees potential in you, a rival worthy of his attention. Defeating Vrim often involves enduring longer than he expects or outpacing him by the slimmest of margins. These moments of victory are fleeting but deeply satisfying, a testament to your growth and resilience.

Despite the constant challenges he presents, Vrim's role in your journey is one of brutal mentorship. His relentless pursuit of perfection, combined with his unwavering determination to test your limits, ensures that you never become complacent.

objects.title: Muad'dib
objects.text:
"I will show you the folly of your compassion."

None know hate like Muad'dib, a monk who once held hope in changing the world through one good deed at a time. This idealism came crashing down when a thief he let heal in his home murdered his wife and child and robbed them of all they had. The betrayal and loss shattered Muad'dib, transforming him from a benevolent monk into a vengeful wanderer.

After avenging the deaths of his family, Muad'dib roams the lands, driven by a burning hatred. He seeks out those who aspire to fix the world, showing them the folly of their acts and the harsh reality that good intentions can have devastating consequences. His once gentle demeanor has hardened into one of relentless bitterness.

Muad'dib's appearance is as fearsome as his reputation. He possesses eight arms, each with an elemental affinity—fire, water, earth, air, lightning, ice, light, and shadow. These powers make him a formidable force, and he wields them with precision and wrath.

objects.title: Yakim Flaimhaired
objects.text:
"By my Mother's will."

Yakim Flaimhaired is Sera's younger brother, a classic mama's boy who will do whatever his mother, Chieftain Flaimtouched, asks of him. His latest mission is to return Sera, the flamekissed, so they can prepare for a proper war with the minotaurs of the Emerald Fields. He is a ruthless and cunning individual, manipulating people to fulfill his wishes through a blend of bribery and charm. His influence extends to the local authorities and the underworld, compelling them to do his bidding through small and minor favors.

At first, his actions manifest as minor inconveniences—slightly increased trade prices to ensure your rations are reduced and occasional harassment from authorities. But it doesn't take long for his tactics to escalate. Soon, you find yourself facing bandit attacks and false crime charges, all orchestrated by Yakim. His relentless pursuit and manipulation stem from his deep-seated yearning for his mother's approval.

Yakim's strategic mind and willingness to exploit any weakness make him a dangerous adversary. His relentless determination to bring Sera back involves using any means necessary, viewing the manipulation and subjugation of others as merely stepping stones toward gaining favor in his mother's eyes.

Your journey is fraught with challenges as you navigate the web of deceit and danger he has woven. Each step forward requires careful planning and vigilance, knowing that Yakim is always one step ahead, ready to strike. His ruthless nature and cunning mind make him a bitter rival, determined to undermine you at every turn.

objects.title: Avina
objects.text:
"I...am proud of you child of Othana."

You remember Avina; it is a day you could never forget. It was the same day she left Sakin, the displacer cub, in your hands. Avina will not be a rival per se, but she will challenge you at every opportunity, forcing you to think outside the box and face your problems head-on. She does this not only to test you but to ensure that you are ready for the challenges ahead.

Avina's demeanor is almost motherly with you. When you fail, she will show you your errors while offering kind words of encouragement. When you succeed, however, she will reward you. You could almost sense the pride hidden behind her veil, a quiet acknowledgment of your growth and achievements.

Her guidance is both demanding and nurturing, pushing you to your limits and beyond. Each challenge she presents is a lesson, a step toward becoming stronger and more resilient.
