Avina's presence in your life is a constant reminder that true strength comes from perseverance and the willingness to learn from both success and failure.

Avina's connection to you goes deeper than mere mentorship. Her bond with Sakin and the promise she made when she left the cub in your care is a testament to her belief in your potential. She sees something within you that is worth nurturing, and her challenges are designed to bring out the best in you. Whether it’s a test of your wits, a trial of your courage, or a lesson in humility, Avina’s methods are as varied as they are effective.

Though she may seem stern at times, Avina’s love and dedication to your growth are evident. Her pride in your achievements is not just a reflection of your success but also of her own efforts to guide you. The moments of praise she offers are rare but deeply meaningful, a silent encouragement that drives you to keep striving for excellence.

In Avina, you find a paradox of strength and gentleness, a mentor who balances the rigors of training with the warmth of care. Her influence shapes not only your abilities but also your character, forging you into a person capable of facing the greatest challenges with confidence and grace.

objects.title: Floki The drake of death
objects.text:
"How do you plan to live your life?"

None have mastered the art of death like Floki. He is a master weapons wielder, and every weapon that touches his hands sings with the clarity of death. None have spilled blood like Floki; the amount itself cannot be measured. As the eldest brother, known as the Drake of Death and Murder, he was the blade that kept the chieftains at bay. He and his mercenaries, at the behest of his youngest brother, tore asunder their enemies.

Floki is a formidable warmaster, and his men follow him with fervor. However, his loyalty and affection are reserved solely for his two younger brothers and their dreams. He is an apathetic man, driven by a singular purpose: to ensure his brothers live a good life, no matter the cost.

He will kill, murder, and rob to achieve this goal, demonstrating a ruthless and relentless nature that knows no bounds. Floki's actions are not driven by a sense of justice or morality, but by a cold, calculating determination to protect his family. Despite his skills and leadership, Floki is not a good man. His heart is hardened by the countless lives he has taken, and his soul bears the weight of his bloody deeds.

Floki's presence on the battlefield is both feared and respected. His men follow him not out of love, but out of fear and the recognition of his unparalleled prowess. He is a complex figure, a blend of loyalty and brutality, whose only redeeming quality is his unwavering commitment to his brothers.

objects.title: Talai and Manid
objects.text:
"Its all for you my heart forge...its all for you."

Talai and Manid are a pair well-known throughout the Mazashi Tundra. Like many from the tundra, Manid forged his own armor and blade, pouring immense love and effort into creating the weapon. The blade was meant for his wife, who died a few years back. She lived for war, and his longing and love for her were so profound that he managed to call back her spirit, which now inhabits the sword.

What Manid doesn't realize is that the spirit within the blade isn't actually his wife, but a djinn that feeds on violence. The djinn constantly urges Manid to fight for it, spilling blood wherever he goes. This malevolent entity preys on Manid's grief and devotion, twisting his memories and fueling his thirst for battle.

Manid's journey is a tragic tale of love, loss, and deception. His actions, driven by the false hope of reuniting with his beloved, have made him a formidable warrior, feared and respected throughout the Mazashi Tundra. Yet, the true nature of the spirit within the blade remains hidden, a dark secret that continues to shape his path.

The djinn within the sword is cunning and manipulative, whispering insidious suggestions that play on Manid's emotions. Each battle fought, each life taken, feeds the djinn's power, binding Manid deeper into its thrall. The bond he believes he shares with his wife's spirit is a cruel illusion, a lie that drives him to ever greater acts of violence.

objects.title: Roshi
objects.text:
Roshi is a well-traveled individual, known far and wide as the boy with the shepherd's stick. His reputation precedes him, and there isn't a village that hasn't heard of his name. Roshi is a kind and compassionate young man who has made it his mission to help those in need, no matter where his journeys take him. Despite having no special powers or abilities, his unwavering determination to assist others has earned him the admiration and gratitude of countless communities.

Roshi's acts of kindness are legendary. He helps the elderly with their chores, tends to the sick, and offers a comforting presence to those who are downtrodden. His empathy and generosity know no bounds, and his selflessness has endeared him to many. The villagers often speak of Roshi with great fondness, recounting tales of his humble deeds and the difference he has made in their lives.

However, becoming an enemy of Roshi is ill-advised. His widespread influence and the goodwill he has garnered mean that villages will turn their backs on those who oppose him. The hospitality that was once extended freely becomes scarce, and the food you buy may be of low quality, if not outright spoiled. The network of communities that respect Roshi will close ranks, making life difficult for anyone who dares to cross him.

objects.title: Iladin Snow
objects.text:
"I'll make you mine one day."

Illadin, the current leader of the Emerald Field resistance, is a force to be reckoned with. As a minotaur, she has a deep connection to the land and its people, and her unwavering determination to lead the resistance makes her a formidable leader. When she sees you, especially if you are a minotaur like her, she immediately recognizes your potential as an asset to her cause.

Illadin will stop at nothing to recruit you to her side of the war. She employs a variety of tactics, from bribery to extortion, to sway you to join her ranks. Her unyielding and intense nature means that she will not take no for an answer, continually finding new ways to persuade and pressure you into aligning with her cause.

Her dedication to the resistance is absolute, and she believes that every capable individual should contribute to the fight against their oppressors. Illadin's relentless pursuit of your allegiance is both a testament to her strategic mind and a reflection of the high stakes of the conflict.

As you navigate your interactions with Illadin, you'll find that her passion for the resistance is matched only by her determination to see you by her side. Her intensity can be overwhelming, but it also underscores the gravity of the struggle she leads.

objects.title: Lady Allender
objects.text:
"Be it so."

Mievera, twin sister to Karana, has lived a life shrouded in secrecy, a hidden existence orchestrated by her mother, High Lady Allender. From birth, Mievera was raised away from her sister and father, Grevin, in order to serve as a backup plan. Unlike her father's necromantic powers, Mievera was born with the magic of life, a power that stands in stark contrast to the darkness that surrounds her family. High Lady Allender, recognizing the potential of Mievera's abilities, groomed her in isolation, preparing her to be a contingency in their grand plans.

Mievera's potential was immense; in a different era, she would have been revered as a high priestess of the Elven Empire, a beacon of healing and life. However, knowing this, her mother resurrected the cult, placing Mievera at its helm as a figurehead. This act was not out of love or pride, but a strategic move to harness Mievera's powers for the cult's benefit.

Despite the weight of expectations and the mantle of leadership forced upon her, Mievera remains detached and apathetic. She cares little for the cult, her family, or the power she wields. She goes through the motions, fulfilling her mother's commands not out of conviction, but because she knows no other way to live. Her life is a series of empty actions, devoid of personal ambition or emotional connection, a stark contrast to the vibrant potential of the magic she possesses.

objects.title: Midnight lord
objects.text:
"...that was a mistake child of Othana."

Jakrin, the Midnight Lord, is the enigmatic and shadowy father of the Midnight Cult. Despite his appearance, he is an ancient entity, older than the cult itself, which, unbeknownst to the public, has existed for centuries. His true age and origins are shrouded in mystery, and his presence evokes a sense of awe and fear among those who have heard of him.

Jakrin's demeanor is one of quiet intensity. He spends most of his time studying those around him, his gaze piercing and observant. His motives and end goals remain a mystery to all, adding to the aura of secrecy that surrounds him. Those who encounter him feel the weight of his scrutiny, as if he is constantly evaluating and analyzing their every move.

The Midnight Lord's influence extends far and wide, his reach infiltrating the darkest corners of society. He operates from the shadows, his actions and intentions known only to a select few within the cult.

Jakrin's ultimate purpose is a closely guarded secret, and even those within the cult are left guessing at his true intentions. His inscrutable nature and the layers of mystery surrounding him make him a figure of fascination and fear. The Midnight Lord's presence is a constant reminder of the hidden depths and ancient powers that govern the world from the shadows.

objects.title: The smith
objects.text:
"Not good enough...never good enough."

No one actually knows her true name; everyone simply refers to her as "The Smith." She is a legendary figure, having spent countless years at the Heart Forge within the Mazashi Tundra. Her exact age remains a mystery, as she has never left the Heart Forge since her arrival. The Smith dedicates every moment to her craft, tirelessly striving to recreate the wonders of old. Her works are among the finest in the world, and even those she deems failures are considered masterpieces by others.

The relentless heat of the forge has transformed The Smith's body, causing her flesh to radiate with an intense, almost otherworldly warmth. This transformation serves as a testament to her unwavering dedication and the countless hours she has spent perfecting her craft. The forge's fire is not only a source of her strength but also a symbol of her indomitable spirit and relentless pursuit of perfection.

Her skills as a master blacksmith are unparalleled, and her creations are coveted by warriors and leaders from far and wide. Each piece she forges carries a piece of her essence, imbued with the same passion and precision that defines her work. Despite the acclaim and reverence she receives, The Smith remains her own harshest critic. The words "Not good enough...never good enough" echo in her mind, driving her to push the boundaries of her abilities further and further.

The Smith's enigmatic nature and the aura of mystery surrounding her only add to her legend. She rarely speaks, letting her creations speak for her. Those who seek her out know that making an enemy of The Smith is a grave mistake, for her influence extends far beyond the walls of the Heart Forge.

rows.title: Early Life events(WIP)
rows.titleText: What life events shaped you crimson? What led you to meet your companions? What made you rise above your rivals? Who were your enemies? What broke or healed you? Who taught you? Who did you love? How many did you leave behind? Tell me, child of the red, what made you?

objects.title: The lover
objects.text:
One look was all it took. The instant their eyes met yours, your souls became entwined, igniting a fire greater than Yamare’s celestial gaze—a flame that words could never capture. Each shared moment was sweeter than the last: their touch, filled with hunger and need; their poems and gifts, brimming with affection; the way they cradled you, offering security and comfort.
Whatever the future holds, one thing is certain—there will always be another beside you. Someone who will walk through the coldest hells and the hottest heavens to stand by your side.

objects.title: The lover
objects.text: You spent the days in each others arms, kissing were given by the plenty, gazes lingered and touche

objects.title: To drink or not to drink
objects.text:
The alcohol flowed freely, laughter even more so. It was the Festival of Love and Life, where the day belonged to dancers and the night to lovers. Friends and family gathered under the stars, while passion ignited in hidden corners.
Presided over by the priestess of Natune—the dual deity of spring and fertility—the festival welcomed all. Food and drink were abundant, and no one was turned away. From kings to paupers, priests to courtesans, every soul found their place in the revelry.
As the moon reached its zenith, the air grew thick with the scent of blooming flowers and spiced wine. Musicians played haunting melodies that seemed to weave through the crowd, binding strangers in shared moments of joy. Fires burned brightly in every corner, casting flickering shadows that danced alongside the revelers. The priestess herself moved among the crowd, blessing lovers with petals of spring and whispers of fertility, her presence a living embodiment of Natune’s grace.

objects.title: Carpe Diem
objects.text:
You spent the days with your allies, indulging in a feast for both the body and the spirit. Pies of every variety graced the table—rich with game meats, fragrant with herbs, or filled with sweet, syrupy fruits. Tender cuts of venison and hearty stews complemented rare delicacies that lingered on your taste buds, each bite a new discovery. Between meals, laughter erupted as you and your companions competed in games of boast and skill, testing your aim, strength, and cunning. Every shared success and playful rivalry tightened the bonds between you, weaving a fellowship stronger than steel.
As the sun dipped low and painted the skies with hues of amber and crimson, you found yourselves gathered around the crackling fire. Tales of past glories and whispered dreams of the future mingled with the warmth of the flames. The light danced on familiar faces, reminding you that in this fleeting moment of joy, you weren’t just allies—you were family. These were the days that fortified your spirit, the memories that would carry you through even the darkest nights.

objects.title: Carpe Noctem
objects.text:
As the sun dipped below the horizon, the festival shifted into its second act. Families retreated to their homes, leaving the streets to couples and lovers. Some strolled hand in hand, their laughter mingling with the distant music, while others, consumed by passion, shed their inhibitions—and their garments—beneath the flickering lanterns.
Your allies scattered, each finding their own path. Some disappeared into the shadows with newfound partners, while others sought solace in quiet corners or returned to their rooms, content to let the night unfold without them.
If you had a life partner, their touch was electric, their moans harmonizing with the symphony of pleasure that filled the air. And if you didn’t—well, the night offered its own diversions, whether in the thrill of the dance, the allure of the stars, or the intoxicating freedom of solitude.

objects.title: The arena of Dawn
objects.text:
From the Rugaru Wilds to the Entefe Alps, the tales of the Games are whispered in every corner of the realm. Warriors and mages, rogues and sorcerers, thieves and assassins—all are drawn to the Arena of Dawn, a colossal battleground nestled deep within the golden expanse of the Rikan Tarvin Savannah, the very seat of the empire's power. Here, amidst roaring crowds and blinding sunlight, spell and blade clash in a breathtaking spectacle, leaving the earth scorched and air crackling with energy.
The Games offer a variety of challenges to test skill and spirit. Chariot races and archery contests entertain the masses, filled with light-hearted rivalry. But no event draws the same fervor as the legendary King of the Hill battles. In this brutal free-for-all, it’s every combatant for themselves, the arena erupting in chaos as hundreds vie for dominance. By dawn, only one warrior will remain standing, earning the ultimate prize: a single wish granted by the emperor himself—a gift coveted by all but given to only the strongest.

objects.title: Participated
objects.text:
You stepped into the Arena of Dawn, the roaring cheers of the crowd shaking the very air around you. "Child of Crimson," they called you, a name spoken with equal parts awe and curiosity. Whether your blade sang with victory or your spells faltered in the chaos, one truth remained: you emerged from the fray not as you entered.
Every strike and counter, every choice between caution and risk, forged you sharper than any weapon. You carried away lessons etched into muscle and mind, scars both visible and hidden. The taste of battle, the grit of survival, and the camaraderie—or rivalry—formed amidst the clash of warriors would follow you, their echoes guiding you in battles yet to come.

objects.title: Watched
objects.text:
From your vantage point above the fray, the chaos unraveled itself into patterns invisible to those caught within it. You saw how the swift underestimated the cunning, how brute force crumbled against precision, and how the smallest hesitation sealed fates. Each clash of steel and surge of magic revealed something more—a momentary tell, a glimmer of strategy, a rhythm to the mayhem.
These glimpses of insight were gifts only an observer could claim. You saw not just strength and skill, but also fear, resolve, and the human drive to overcome. Though you stood apart, you gained an understanding deeper than any battle could teach. It wasn't merely a contest of power—it was a dance of survival, of will, and of wit. What you learned that day would become its own kind of strength.

objects.title: The heist
objects.text:
It was supposed to be easy—a quick job, an opportunity to pad your purses with a bit more travel money. But fate had other plans. What began as a simple task spiraled into chaos. Part of the duchy’s prized vineyard now lies scorched, reduced to ash under circumstances none of you can fully agree upon. Then there were the peacocks—those cursed, flesh-hungry creatures whose cries still haunt your dreams. Somehow, in the frenzy, you and your companions managed to escape, though not without a few new scars, both physical and otherwise.
To this day, whispers of that fateful night echo from taverns to palace halls, growing more elaborate with each retelling. Some call it the most disastrous operation ever undertaken—a tale of blunders and bad luck. Others recount it as a legendary feat, a wild and impossible escapade that has earned you a reputation equal parts infamous and heroic. Whatever the truth may be, it seems this particular job will forever live on in both rumour and memory.

What did you steal?

objects.title: The heist
objects.text:
True enough, you didn’t leave the Vault of Etafu entirely empty-handed. The scars you carry now are like a rogue's medals, each one with its own wild story to tell—reminders of the traps you narrowly escaped and the challenges you overcame. And then there’s the trinket, small and unassuming, yet radiating an aura that hints at deeper mysteries.
Whether it’s a simple memento or a relic of greater power, who can say? Perhaps it holds a secret yet to be unveiled, or maybe it’s just a talisman of your survival—a symbol that you braved the impossible and walked away alive. Time, as always, will tell. Shall we dive into what this trinket might be or what stories these scars could whisper? The tale is yours to shape.

objects.title: The heist
objects.text:
It took a dangerous cocktail of skill, sheer luck, and a borderline reckless amount of booze to make it through even a fragment of the traps within the Vault of Etafu. The vault itself was a marvel—and a menace. Every step was a gamble: pressure plates that triggered cascading arrows, walls that shifted without warning, and puzzles that warped reality itself if solved incorrectly.
Some traps tested your wits, others your speed, but most pushed you to the brink of your limits. For every triumphant disarm, there was a narrow escape—a graze of an arrow, a flame that licked too close. By the time you staggered out, treasure in hand or not, it wasn't just your mettle that had been tested, but your very soul. They say the Vault of Etafu has claimed legends and cowards alike, and somehow, you lived to tell your tale.

objects.title: The murder
objects.text:
Waking up with aching bones and the pungent stench of piss, vomit, and cheap ale lingering in the air wasn’t unfamiliar—it was almost routine by now. But this time, something broke the usual haze of regret and soreness: a corpse lying mere inches from you, its lifeless stare cutting through the dim surroundings.
The weight of the discovery pressed into your chest. Was it someone you knew? A stranger? Fragments of the previous night danced in your mind, but none pieced together the presence of the body. As adrenaline replaced lethargy, you couldn't help but wonder—what exactly happened, and why were you still alive?

objects.title: Investigate
objects.text:
You knew an adventure when you saw one, and this one demanded your undivided focus. With nothing but your wits and the lingering haze of last night’s booze to guide you, you threw yourself into the chaos. The city became your labyrinth, its every shadow and whispered alley offering fragments of the truth, layered thick with half-truths and blurred recollections.
You interrogated witnesses, their accounts as broken and contradictory as the night itself, and struck deals in the gloom of back alleys, swapping coin or risky promises for elusive scraps of information. Each lead brought you closer to unraveling the tangled mystery, though not without brushing close to danger and making choices you’d rather not linger on.
A true testament to the adventurer's creed: where cheap ale fuels the courage and luck smooths the rough edges of peril. Through sheer instinct, determination, and just enough recklessness, you managed to make it through and carve out another story worth retelling. Perhaps it’s not the finest strategy in the eyes of the wise, but sometimes, a little booze and blind fortune are all you need to tilt fate in your favor.

objects.title: Investigate
objects.text:
Well, it’s not like you knew the chum, right? Gritting your teeth, you downed the flat, horrid swill from the night before—it burned worse going down than you’d remembered. With a pang of regret, you left the scene of the crime, the stranger’s belongings tucked away in your pockets. Trinkets, perhaps, or something far more valuable—something that might explain why they lay lifeless while you walked away.
The trail led you to their family—a twisted cult whose grotesque rituals and chilling chants revealed their dark devotion. Before you could fully grasp the danger, they turned their attention to you, their newest offering to whatever entity they worshipped. Bound and surrounded, you fought against the rising tide of fear, relying on your wits, grit, and a flicker of luck to escape their grasp. Though you walked away alive, the scars—both visible and hidden—remain, along with the haunting memory of their empty, purpose-filled eyes

objects.title: The cove
objects.text:
The journey paused at the perfect spot—a hidden cove where the waters shimmered in shades of crystal blue, gentle waves lapping at the pristine white sands. The air carried the soft scent of salt and warmth, inviting nothing but peace and quiet.
You and your companions settled in, casting aside worries and gear for a moment of respite. Some lounged in the sun, letting its rays melt away the fatigue of past adventures, while others waded into the calm sea, laughter echoing as waves danced around them. The simple joys of the day—skipping stones, sharing tales, or just basking in the stillness—reminded you all that even amidst the thrill of the journey, there’s a beauty in pausing to appreciate the world around you.

How did you spend your time

objects.title: The love cove
objects.text:
The day unfolded like a cherished memory in the making. The secluded cove, with its glistening waters and soft white sands, became a canvas for your shared romance. You and your lover basked in the golden embrace of the sun, its warmth turning every touch into a quiet thrill. Laughter echoed as you floated together in the clear blue waves, letting the gentle currents carry you into moments of playful closeness and quiet intimacy.
You explored the beauty of the shoreline hand in hand, leaving footprints that felt like promises written in the sand. As the sun dipped toward the horizon, the sky was painted in fiery hues, and you found yourselves sitting close, sharing whispered secrets and dreams for the future. The day wasn’t just one of relaxation; it was a celebration of your bond, each moment deepening your connection. Whether it was the shared smiles, the knowing glances, or the quiet comfort of just being together, the memories felt eternal.

objects.title: The fishing cove
objects.text:
The day began as a simple plan to fish, but quickly unfolded into an adventure worth remembering. With the sun warming your back and the gentle lapping of the waves against the shoreline, you cast your line, letting the rhythm of nature guide you. The fish fought hard, testing your patience and skill, but each catch brought its own sense of triumph.
Along the way, you encountered another—a fellow traveler drawn by the same serene waters. At first, it was a brief exchange of greetings, but soon enough, stories were swapped, laughter shared, and a camaraderie forged. Together, you tackled the challenges of the day, offering tips and tricks for the perfect catch and celebrating each success as though it were a shared victory. The quiet joy of fishing was made richer by the connection, turning a simple outing into a memorable chapter in your journey.

objects.title: The spring
objects.text:
The journey had worn you down to the bone, each step heavier than the last. Days on the road with barely a moment’s rest had drained you and your companions. The basilisk, a terror to the nearby town, now lay dead thanks to your efforts, but victory had come at a cost. Bruised, battered, and utterly exhausted, you pressed on, only to discover that even your path back to safety had betrayed you. A wrong turn had left you wandering through unfamiliar woods.
But then, as if the forest took pity on you, the trees parted to reveal a hidden sanctuary. A hot spring lay before you, its crystal-clear waters shrouded in rising steam that promised warmth and relief. The air around it was heavy with the scent of minerals and damp earth, and the gentle bubbling of the water was like a lullaby to your frayed nerves. This wasn’t just a spring—it was a gift, a chance to shed your burdens and let the soothing waters work their magic.

objects.title: Take a dip
objects.text:
The waters embraced you like an old friend, their warmth seeping into your weary muscles and washing away every ache left from the road. As you submerged yourself, a deep sigh escaped, mirrored by the relieved murmurs of your companions. The spring seemed almost magical, its gentle bubbling lulling your minds into a rare, blissful tranquility.
For once, the weight of past battles and the uncertainties of the journey ahead dissolved in the soothing embrace of the hot spring. Laughter replaced exhaustion as you shared lighthearted tales, the steam curling around you like a protective veil. It was a stolen moment of peace, a fleeting pause in a life of chaos—and you savored every second.

objects.title: No time to waste
objects.text:
Time was precious, and the call of the road louder than the allure of the spring. With resolve stiffening your aching limbs, you and your companions pushed forward, navigating through the dense woods. Though exhaustion gnawed at you, your determination cut through the fog of fatigue.
Your persistence paid off. When you finally reached your destination, the town welcomed you as heroes once more. News of your success—and perhaps your discipline in foregoing the spring—had traveled ahead. To your surprise, the reward wasn’t just generous, it was doubled. Among the glittering coins and treasures, you found an item that caught your eye—something rare, something extraordinary. What it is or what it does, time and adventure will reveal, but for now, it stands as a symbol of your grit and unwavering resolve.

rows.title: Sagas(WIP)
rows.titleText: Now we know what made you what you are crimson. Now let us get to the meat of the story. What events changed the history of your world and what role did you play in them? Once you start a saga you must see It through, take only those you trust yourself to complete.

rows.title: First saga
rows.titleText:
You and your companions had just finished a harrowing adventure that involved, a donkey, obscene amounts of rope and a single gold coin. Why were these three crucial to the success of your latest tale in a story for another day? No, what mattered was spending your latest payout on as much booze and food as you could. The atmosphere was light in the tavern where you chose to drink away your earnings. Friends surrounded you, their tales washing over you as they spoke with delight. The mead was sweet, the ale was sour and the food was plenty steeped with flavour. It was a good night.
 
A scream tore through the festive mood. The hiss of blades leaving their sheathes filled the vacuum like the hiss of a dozen vipers. 

The first one came through the window, the second through the window. The third and fourth you missed as dozens more filled whatever crevasse there be. They were creatures of mutilated flesh and red-glowing veins. An undead the likes you'd sever seen before. Flame, arrow and blade engulfed their forms as every adventurer in the room raced to put them down. Wave after wave they came you watched as the young and inexperienced fell first under the onslaught. You watched as the barmaid who'd only just poured you a drink had her through ripped off. 

As soon as it started the battle was over. Bodies both human and inhuman lay in scattered heaps. Each mutilated by teeth, blades, poison and magik. A stillness settled over

rows.title: Fifth saga(WIP)
rows.titleText:
It begins—the first colossals have broken free of the breach. They march, heading straight for each major city.

Maravaki, the colossal of smoke and ash, blackens the sky as he makes his way towards the Emerald Fields to the east. The once vibrant landscape is shrouded in darkness, the sun obscured by billowing clouds of soot and cinders.

Karatin, the colossal of waves, marches towards the savannahs. The cities flood long before his arrival, as a moving tsunami engulfs everything in its path. The relentless surge of water leaves devastation in its wake, transforming the savannahs into a watery wasteland.

Rikin, the colossal of mist, worms his way into the jungles of Kavikan. What the mist touches, it corrupts, transforming flora and fauna into twisted abominations that wish to rip and tear, leaving carnage in their wake. The once lush and vibrant jungle becomes a nightmarish realm of horror and destruction.

Finally, in the Mazashi Tundra emerges the vengeance of Zliken, he who is many. From the earth come thousands of golems made of stone and metal, an endless wave of enemies hellbent on destroying all that call the tundra home. The ground trembles as these monstrous creations march forward, their singular purpose to obliterate everything in their path.

The world stands on the brink of chaos, as these unstoppable forces of nature converge on the major cities, bringing with them a tide of destruction and despair. The challenge ahead is monumental, and only the bravest and most resourceful can hope to stand against the oncoming storm.

rows.title: Loyalty Sagas(WIP)
rows.titleText: Loyalty Saga's. Take however many you qualify for.

objects.title: The maskfiend twins.
objects.text:
You will soon find out that the mask are slowly killing the twins. There are two ways of counteracting this. One is finding a warlock strong enough to unbound them from their masks. This will be painful and would leave the twins emotionally stunted for a few weeks. Closely watch over them, for Groko will end the world by taking off his mask after growing tired of wearing it. Krogo will slowly destroy themselves looking for every drug and drink under the sun so as to feel something once more. 
The other way is to defeat their Father.
He is a reason the twins are strong. Their Father was a great warlock who wanted a legacy of strong children. Imparted lessons and eldritch teaching that left the twins broken and scarred afterwards. Expect to face magiks and runes that would put the powers of both twins to shame.
You will face many of her failed experiments each wearing unique masks with unique effects. Each is mad and in a constant state of agony. There will be four of these stronger than the rest. These are the siblings of the twins, each in a state of constant madness and agony. Killing them will be difficult even more so if you want to subdue them. However, if you are versed in magiks or runes it will be easier stop them. If not good luck this will be trying you will not come out and scathed. Gain the chronic pain drawback(One of the siblings will slam your back against the ground). It will last for a year.

objects.title: The family of flamehaired.
objects.text:
Sera’s mother is a great warlord, the emerald fields shudder at the mention of the name flamehaired. For all her children are great warriors. Sera being the runt of the litter. For decades now Warlord flaimhaired has tried to make the emerald fields her own. Sending army upon army of her country men after the fields. The body count is of such a magnitude that in the coming year the emerald fields will soon be called the scarlet rot. Any more bloodshed and the fields will not bare food for decades if not generations. For his ill-conceived war has cost both sides deeply. An accord was reached by those that weren’t cowed or bribed by the flamehaired.  As well as the mintori who tire of the war and would like to return to the fields to till. 
Sera will ask you to accompany her to right the wrong she participated in. Expect to meet opposition from Sera’s siblings, her eldest brother a kind man with a heart of could and mommy issues will be your final challenger. He has the pankration greater ability. 
There are two ways to go about this one if you have the pankration perk you can go toe to toe with him trading blow for blow. Until one of you yields. Will take every you have to keep up with him. By the end of the fight, you will be victorious. Head bloodied but unbowed. Though the exhaustion and injuries will take their toll. You will collapse and Sera’s mother will take the opportunity to attack both you and her. Sera will defend on you and defeat her mother though she will be injured and cannot accompany you for one quest. 
If Sera instead fights her sibling the battle will be great. All will bear witness as the flaimhaired defeats champion after champion until it is time to defeat her brother. The fight wil be great shaing the very ground beneath your feet. The clans will watch, the mintori will watch, you will watch as Sera takes blow after blow. Refusing to spill her sibling’s blood. Sera will be a bloodied and broken mess but will remain standing. Her brother will refuse to kill her and no other champion will stand against her. They will be impressed by her resilience and determination. The clans will awestruck whispering the name flaimehaired with respect. Seeing the tide turn against her Sera’s mother will attack gravely wounding Sera brother. Seeing this the rage that she had kept hidden will explode forth. Though this  will not be a blind rage. This will awaken the greater rage within Sera. All that pain all that misery from all those hears of fighting and killing will explode forth. Sera will break her mother, blow after blow, strike after strike until she surrenders.

objects.title: Destruction of the jade horde
objects.text: Kenassa will come to you one day. She has found those who enslaved and killed her family. The jade hoard is a group of slavers, rapists and murderers. They prowl the lands marauding and killing. She wants your help to end their cruel games. You will have to find their base of operations an island far offshore.

rows.title: Loyalty saga Rewards(WIP)
rows.titleText: Rewards you've gained from completeting a loyalty saga.

objects.title: Fiendmask
objects.text:
You get a power like Krogo, though your summons are blood red. It will be a painful experience having the mask bonded to your soul. It will hurt, you will be left a reck. You will have nightmare every two weeks for the first two years. A part of your soul will be carved out to make the mask. 
You will be able summon your emotions like beasts. There appearance will vary wildly, however they will each be very powerful. Depending on what emotion you feel the strongest. If you bottle your emotions without faces them. You will starve the beasts. Once starved long enough they will break free of the mask and devour all that is before them. Though if you deal with your emotions accept them for what they are in the moment. Then your beasts will become stronger for it. The goal is not to defeat them or chain them. But to accept them as a part of yourself. To wear this mask is a commitment. A commitment to none other than yourself and the crimson.

objects.title: The rune bound book.
objects.text: Once you start reading the book you will go mad for exactly 7hours7minutes and 7 seconds. Your mind will be open to all the knowledge the maskmaker. This wisdom will he over a century old, your mind is not ready for it. After time of madness is over some of your memories will be missing replaced with that of the maskmaker. You will have only a fraction of their knowledge on runes, though this knowledge will give you an edge in runemagiks. One that would have taken you decades to gain. After seven days your memories will return the knowledge having been integrated within.

objects.title: Twins loyalty
objects.text:
Seeing their Father either dead or defeat will give them some closure. The twins will start their long journey of healing. Krogo will be less of an ass, her anger will be directed on those deserving. Groko will no longer cry himself to sleep, he will no longer hate his face and one day be able to take of the mask without ending the world. The twins will also be grateful if you subdued their siblings without killing them. They will leave your group for a year, so as to settle their siblings. You may join the twins though you cannot take any other quests during this time. During this time they will heal as a family, growing accustomed to the stray hug here and here. Every stray touch between you and the twins will start to last always a little longer. Soon Krogo growing every more daring and interested. On the final year Groko will quiet literally jump you and drag you to their bed. 
Groko will be calmer and gentler, constantly asking if you ‘like this’ or ‘want it this way’.
If you aren’t interested in that the twins will consider you family. And will trust you with their lives. You may take an additional sibling from the end as a companions for free. They will join you on your journey.

rows.title: Legend
rows.titleText:
The sun rises or does it?
Is your name sung with jubilation or is scorned and met with spit?
Who are you crimson?
Do they call you hero or traitor? King or Tyrant?

defaultRowText: This is a row, and inside of it, you can place choices. On both rows and choices Requirements can be placed, which will block a row from being viewed, or make the player unable to select a choice, depending on either Point-types or the Ids of other choices. Point-types can be made in Features then Manage Points. Hovering over buttons will explain what they do. The Design of the project can be changed in 'Modify Design' at the side navigation bar, and private styling for each row can be turned on in the rows Settings. Default text like this can be turned off in Features -> Manage Defaults.
